questions.question: Leadership needs to populate a dynamic form field with a summary or description created by a large language model (LLM) to facilitate more productive conversations with customers. Leadership also wants to keep a human in the loop to be considered in their AI strategy. Which prompt template type should the AI Specialist recommend?
options: Sales Email
Field Generation
Record Summary
questions.answer: Field Generation
questions.explanation: The Field Generation template is specifically designed to dynamically populate individual fields with AI-generated content (like summaries or descriptions). It supports a 'human-in-the-loop' workflow because the generated text is placed into a field where a user can review and edit it before saving.

questions.question: Universal Containers is considering leveraging the Einstein Trust Layer in conjunction with Einstein Generative AI Audit Data. Which audit data is available using the Einstein Trust Layer?
options: Response accuracy and offensiveness score
Hallucination score and bias score
Masked data and toxicity score
questions.answer: Masked data and toxicity score
questions.explanation: The Einstein Trust Layer audits focus on safety and privacy. It logs what data was masked (to protect PII) and assigns a toxicity score to the generated output to ensure it meets safety guidelines.

questions.question: Universal Containers wants to make a sales proposal and directly use data from multiple unrelated objects (standard and custom) in a prompt template. What should the AI Specialist recommend?
options: Create a Flex template to add resources with standard and custom objects as inputs.
Create a prompt template passing in a special custom object that connects the records temporarily.
Create a prompt template-triggered flow to access the data from standard and custom objects.
questions.answer: Create a Flex template to add resources with standard and custom objects as inputs.
questions.explanation: Flex Templates in Prompt Builder are designed for complex scenarios where you need to bring in data from multiple, potentially unrelated objects. You can define specific resources (inputs) for the template, allowing you to mash up data from different parts of Salesforce.

questions.question: What is an AI Specialist able to do when the “Enrich event logs with conversation data" setting in Einstein Copilot is enabled?
options: View the user click path that led to each copilot action.
View session data including user Input and copilot responses for sessions over the past 7 days.
Generate details reports on all Copilot conversations over any time period.
questions.answer: View session data including user Input and copilot responses for sessions over the past 7 days.
questions.explanation: Enabling this setting allows admins to see the actual conversational payloads (what the user said and what the Copilot replied) in the event logs. This detailed data is retained for 7 days for debugging and analysis purposes.

questions.question: Universal Containers’ current AI data masking rules do not align with organizational privacy and security policies and requirements. What should an AI Specialist recommend to resolve the issue?
options: Enable data masking for sandbox refreshes.
Configure data masking in the Einstein Trust Layer setup.
Add new data masking rules in LLM setup.
questions.answer: Configure data masking in the Einstein Trust Layer setup.
questions.explanation: Data masking for Generative AI is managed specifically within the Einstein Trust Layer settings. This is where you define which data categories (like PII) should be masked before being sent to the LLM.

questions.question: An administrator wants to check the response of the Flex prompt template they've built, but the preview button is greyed out. What is the reason for this?
options: The records related to the prompt have not been selected.
The prompt has not been saved and activated.
A merge field has not been inserted in the prompt.
questions.answer: The records related to the prompt have not been selected.
questions.explanation: To preview a prompt template, especially a Flex template that relies on specific inputs, you must select sample records for those inputs. Without selected records, the system cannot resolve the merge fields to generate a preview.

questions.question: Universal Containers’ data science team is hosting a generative large language model (LLM) on Amazon Web Services (AWS). What should the team use to access externally-hosted models in the Salesforce Platform?
options: Model Builder
App Builder
Copilot Builder
questions.answer: Model Builder
questions.explanation: Model Builder (part of Einstein Studio) is the tool used to connect Salesforce to external LLMs (Bring Your Own Model or BYOM), such as those hosted on AWS Bedrock or other platforms.

questions.question: An AI Specialist built a Field Generation prompt template that worked for many records, but users are reporting random failures with token limit errors. What is the cause of the random nature of this error?
options: The number of tokens generated by the dynamic nature of the prompt template will vary by record.
The template type needs to be switched to Flex to accommodate the variable amount of tokens generated by the prompt grounding.
The number of tokens that can be processed by the LLM varies with total user demand.
questions.answer: The number of tokens generated by the dynamic nature of the prompt template will vary by record.
questions.explanation: Prompt templates pull in data from records (grounding). Some records have very little data (few tokens), while others might have extensive notes or descriptions. If a specific record has too much data, it can push the total token count over the LLM's limit, causing sporadic errors.

questions.question: An administrator is responsible for ensuring the security and reliability of Universal Containers' (UC) CRM data. UC needs enhanced data protection and up-to-date AI capabilities. UC also needs to include relevant information from a Salesforce record to be merged with the prompt. Which feature in the Einstein Trust Layer best supports UC's need?
options: Data masking
Dynamic grounding with secure data retrieval
Zero-data retention policy
questions.answer: Dynamic grounding with secure data retrieval
questions.explanation: Dynamic grounding is the feature that allows the AI to fetch real-time, relevant data from Salesforce records (secure retrieval) and merge it into the prompt context. This ensures the AI is working with up-to-date CRM data.

questions.question: How does Einstein Copilot handle user requests In Salesforce?
options: Einstein Copilot will trigger a flow that utilizes a prompt template to generate the message.
Einstein Copilot will perform an HTTP callout to an LLM provider.
Einstein Copilot analyzes the user's request and LLM technology is used to generate and display the appropriate response.
questions.answer: Einstein Copilot analyzes the user's request and LLM technology is used to generate and display the appropriate response.
questions.explanation: Einstein Copilot uses a reasoning engine. It analyzes the user's natural language request to understand intent, plans actions, and uses the LLM to generate the final response displayed to the user.

questions.question: Universal Containers wants to utilize Einstein for Sales to help sales reps reach their sales quotas by providing Al-generated plans containing guidance and steps for closing deals. Which feature should the AI Specialist recommend to the sales team?
options: Find Similar Deals
Create Account Plan
Create Close Plan
questions.answer: Create Close Plan
questions.explanation: The 'Create Close Plan' feature is specifically designed to analyze an opportunity and generate a tactical plan with steps and guidance to help the sales rep close that specific deal.

questions.question: How does the Einstein Trust Layer ensure that sensitive data is protected while generating useful and meaningful responses?
options: Masked data will be de-masked during response journey.
Masked data will be de-masked during request journey.
Responses that do not meet the relevance threshold will be automatically rejected.
questions.answer: Masked data will be de-masked during response journey.
questions.explanation: To ensure the final response makes sense to the user, the Trust Layer re-inserts the real data (de-masks) into the response after it comes back from the LLM, provided the user has permission to see it.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to enable its sales team to get insights into product and competitor names mentioned during calls. How should UC meet this requirement?
options: Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, assign permission sets, define recording managers, and customize insights with up to 50 competitor names.
Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, connect a recording provider, assign permission sets, and customize insights with up to 25 products.
Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, enable sales recording, assign permission sets, and customize insights with up to 50 products.
questions.answer: Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, enable sales recording, assign permission sets, and customize insights with up to 50 products.
questions.explanation: To get insights, you must enable Einstein Conversation Insights (ECI). Sales Recording (or a connector) is needed to capture the audio. Then, you configure 'Keywords' for products and competitors. (Note: While standard limits are often 25, the provided text indicates Option C with '50 products' as the intended correct answer for this specific exam dump version).

questions.question: What is the role of the large language model (LLM) in executing an Einstein Copilot Action?
options: Find similar requests and provide actions that need to be executed
Identify the best matching actions and correct order of execution
Determine a user's access and sort actions by priority to be executed
questions.answer: Identify the best matching actions and correct order of execution
questions.explanation: The LLM serves as the 'reasoning engine'. It parses the user's intent and matches it against the library of available actions to determine which action to run and in what sequence to solve the user's problem.

questions.question: A service agent is looking at a custom object that stores travel information... needs to review the Knowledge articles about canceling and rebooking. Which Einstein Copilot capability helps the agent accomplish this?
options: Execute tasks based on available actions, answering questions using information from accessible Knowledge articles.
Invoke a flow which makes a call to external data to create a Knowledge article.
Generate a Knowledge article based off the prompts that the agent enters to create steps to cancel flights.
questions.answer: Execute tasks based on available actions, answering questions using information from accessible Knowledge articles.
questions.explanation: Copilot can perform actions (like flows for cancellations) AND answer questions by retrieving data from Knowledge articles (RAG) in the same conversation.

questions.question: An AI Specialist has created a copilot custom action using flow as the reference action type. However, it is not delivering the expected results to the conversation preview, and therefore needs troubleshooting. What should the AI Specialist do to identify the root cause of the problem?
options: In Copilot Builder within the Dynamic Panel, turn on dynamic debugging to show the inputs and outputs.
Copilot Builder within the Dynamic Panel, confirm selected action and observe the values in Input and Output sections.
In Copilot Builder, verify the utterance entered by the user and review session event logs for debug information.
questions.answer: In Copilot Builder within the Dynamic Panel, turn on dynamic debugging to show the inputs and outputs.
questions.explanation: The Dynamic Panel (Plan Canvas/Debug) in Copilot Builder allows builders to see exactly how the planner selected the action and what variables were passed into and out of the Flow in real-time.

questions.question: A support team handles a high volume of chat interactions... Responses must be grounded in the organization's knowledge base... Which feature in Einstein for Service should the support team use?
options: Einstein Service Replies
Einstein Reply Recommendations
Einstein Knowledge Recommendations
questions.answer: Einstein Reply Recommendations
questions.explanation: Einstein Reply Recommendations is specifically designed for Chat. It suggests replies based on historical chat transcripts and Knowledge, appearing directly in the chat console.

questions.question: Universal Containers implemented Einstein Copilot for its users. One user complains that Einstein Copilot is not deleting activities from the past 7 days. What is the reason for this issue?
options: Einstein Copilot Delete Record Action permission is not associated to the user.
Einstein Copilot does not have the permission to delete the user's records.
Einstein Copilot does not support the Delete Record action.
questions.answer: Einstein Copilot does not support the Delete Record action.
questions.explanation: By default, Einstein Copilot actions are safer (Query, Create, Update). 'Delete' is a destructive action and is generally not supported as a standard out-of-the-box action for safety reasons.

questions.question: Where should the AI Specialist go to add/update actions assigned to a copilot?
options: Copilot Actions page, the record page for the copilot action, or the Copilot Action Library tab
Copilot Actions page or Global Actions
Copilot Detail page, Global Actions, or the record page for the copilot action
questions.answer: Copilot Actions page, the record page for the copilot action, or the Copilot Action Library tab
questions.explanation: Copilot actions are managed centrally. You can configure them in the 'Copilot Actions' setup page, or access them via the Library tab within the builder.

questions.question: Universal Containers wants to reduce overall agent handling time minimizing the time spent typing routine answers for common questions in-chat, and reducing the post-chat analysis by suggesting values for case fields. Which combination of Einstein for Service features enables this effort?
options: Einstein Service Replies and Work Summaries
Einstein Reply Recommendations and Case Summaries
Einstein Reply Recommendations and Case Classification
questions.answer: Einstein Reply Recommendations and Case Classification
questions.explanation: Reply Recommendations helps *during* the chat (reducing typing). Case Classification helps *after/during* case creation by predicting field values (reducing analysis/data entry time).

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) is looking to enhance its operational efficiency... What is a key reason for implementing Einstein Copilot?
options: Improving data entry and data cleansing
Allowing AI to perform tasks without user interaction
Streamlining workflows and automating repetitive tasks
questions.answer: Streamlining workflows and automating repetitive tasks
questions.explanation: The primary value prop of Copilot is to assist users in the flow of work by automating multi-step tasks and streamlining complex workflows via natural language.

questions.question: Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) wants to configure Einstein Trust Layer in its production org but is unable to see the option on the Setup page. After provisioning Data Cloud, which step must an Al Specialist take to make this option available to NTO?
options: Turn on Einstein Copilot.
Turn on Einstein Generative AI
Turn on Prompt Builder.
questions.answer: Turn on Einstein Generative AI
questions.explanation: The 'Einstein Generative AI' setting in Setup is the master switch that enables the Trust Layer and associated GenAI features.

questions.question: Universal Containers wants to implement a solution in Salesforce with a custom UX that allows users to enter a sales order number. Subsequently, the system will invoke a custom prompt template to create and display a summary... Which solution should an AI Specialist implement?
options: Create a screen flow to collect sales order number and invoke the prompt template using the standard 'Prompt Template' flow action.
Create a template-triggered prompt flow and invoke the prompt template using the standard “Prompt Template” flow action.
Create an auto launched flow and invoke the prompt template using the standard “Prompt Template' flow action.
questions.answer: Create a screen flow to collect sales order number and invoke the prompt template using the standard 'Prompt Template' flow action.
questions.explanation: A Screen Flow is the correct tool for building a 'custom UX' to collect user input. Flows can natively call Prompt Templates to generate text and then display it back to the user on the next screen.

questions.question: Universal Containers has seen a high adoption rate of a new feature that uses generative AI to populate a summary field... one user cannot see the generative AlI-enabled field icon next to the summary field. What is the most likely cause of the issue?
options: The user does not have the Prompt Template User permission set assigned.
The prompt template associated with summary field is not activated for that user.
The user does not have the field Generative AI User permission set assigned.
questions.answer: The user does not have the field Generative AI User permission set assigned.
questions.explanation: Seeing the 'sparkle' icon for Field Generation requires specific permissions. If a user lacks the specific GenAI permission set (often 'Einstein GPT User' or similar), the UI elements will not render for them.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) is implementing Einstein Generative AI... UC needs audit and feedback data to be accessible for reporting purposes. What is a consideration for this requirement?
options: Storing this data requires Data Cloud to be provisioned.
Storing this data requires a custom object for data to be configured.
Storing this data requires Salesforce big objects.
questions.answer: Storing this data requires Data Cloud to be provisioned.
questions.explanation: The comprehensive audit trails and feedback logs for the Einstein Trust Layer are stored in Data Cloud to handle the volume and provide analytics capabilities.

questions.question: In Model Playground, which hyperparameters of an existing Salesforce-enabled foundational model can an AI Specialist change?
options: Temperature, Frequency Penalty, Presence Penalty
Temperature, Top-k sampling, Presence Penalty
Temperature, Frequency Penalty, Output Tokens
questions.answer: Temperature, Frequency Penalty, Presence Penalty
questions.explanation: These are the standard hyperparameters exposed in the Model Playground to control the creativity (Temperature) and repetition (Frequency/Presence Penalty) of the LLM.

questions.question: How should an organization use the Einstein Trust layer to audit, track, and view masked data?
options: Utilize the audit trail that captures and stores all LLM submitted prompts in Data Cloud.
In Setup, use Prompt Builder to send a prompt to the LLM requesting for the masked data.
Access the audit trail in Setup and export all user-generated prompts.
questions.answer: Utilize the audit trail that captures and stores all LLM submitted prompts in Data Cloud.
questions.explanation: The Trust Layer integrates with Data Cloud to store the full audit trail, including what data was masked and the toxicity scores, allowing for scalable reporting.

questions.question: An AI Specialist implements Einstein Sales Emails for a sales team... Which grounding technique should the AI Specialist use?
options: Ground with Apex Merge Fields
Ground with Record Merge Fields
Automatic grounding using Draft with Einstein feature
questions.answer: Automatic grounding using Draft with Einstein feature
questions.explanation: The 'Draft with Einstein' feature for Sales Emails has built-in automatic grounding that uses the context of the current record (Lead/Contact) to generate relevant emails without manual merge field setup.

questions.question: Universal Containers needs a tool that can analyze voice and video call records to provide insights on competitor mentions... Which feature provides insights about competitor mentions and coaching opportunities?
options: Call Summaries
Einstein Sales Insights
Call Explorer
questions.answer: Call Explorer
questions.explanation: Call Explorer allows users to query voice/video call transcripts interactively to find specific insights like competitor mentions or coaching moments. (Note: Einstein Conversation Insights is the broader feature, but Call Explorer is the specific tool for interactive analysis).

questions.question: An AI Specialist at Universal Containers (UC) Is tasked with creating a new custom prompt template to populate a field with generated output... Which prompt template type should the AI Specialist use and which consideration should they review?
options: Flex, and that Dynamic Fields is enabled
Field Generation, and that Dynamic Fields is enabled
Field Generation, and that Dynamic Forms is enabled
questions.answer: Field Generation, and that Dynamic Fields is enabled
questions.explanation: The 'Field Generation' template type is specifically for populating fields. Dynamic Fields (in the context of Lightning Pages/Forms) is crucial to ensure the field and the generative capability are visible and functional.

questions.question: Universal Containers plans to implement prompt templates that utilize the standard foundation models. What should the AI Specialist consider when building prompt templates in Prompt Builder?
options: Include multiple-choice questions within the prompt to test the LLM's understanding of the context.
Ask it to role-play as a character in the prompt template to provide more context to the LL
Train LLM with data using different writing styles including word choice, intensifiers, emojis, and punctuation.
questions.answer: Ask it to role-play as a character in the prompt template to provide more context to the LL
questions.explanation: A key prompt engineering technique supported by Prompt Builder is assigning a persona or role (e.g., 'You are a helpful support agent') to the LLM to guide the tone and style of the response.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) has a mature Salesforce org with a lot of data... many legacy fields... ensure Einstein AI can draft responses from a defined data source. Which solution should UC use?
options: Service AI Grounding
Work Summaries
Service Replies
questions.answer: Service AI Grounding
questions.explanation: Service AI Grounding is the feature that allows admins to define exactly which objects and fields (the 'defined data source') the AI is allowed to use for context, preventing it from looking at irrelevant legacy fields.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) is Implementing Service AI Grounding... Which objects should UC select to configure Service AI Grounding?
options: Case, Knowledge, and Case Notes
Case and Knowledge
Case, Case Emails, and Knowledge
questions.answer: Case and Knowledge
questions.explanation: For Service Cloud, the primary objects supported for grounding are the Case object (for context) and the Knowledge object (for answers). Case Notes/Emails are not typically separate configuration selections for grounding in this context.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of Prompt Builder?
options: A tool for developers to use in Visual Studio Code that creates prompts for Apex programming, assisting developers in writing code more efficiently.
A tool that enables companies to create reusable prompts for large language models (LLMs), bringing generative AI responses to their flow of work
A tool within Salesforce offering real-time Al-powered suggestions and guidance to users, Improving productivity and decision-making.
questions.answer: A tool that enables companies to create reusable prompts for large language models (LLMs), bringing generative AI responses to their flow of work
questions.explanation: Prompt Builder is a low-code tool in Salesforce setup that allows admins to create, test, and save prompt templates grounded in CRM data.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to offer personalized service experiences and reduce agent handling time with Al-generated email responses, grounded in Knowledge base. Which AI capability should UC use?
options: Einstein Email Replies
Einstein Service Replies for Email
Einstein Generative Service Replies for Email
questions.answer: Einstein Service Replies for Email
questions.explanation: This feature generates draft email responses for support agents, using context from the case and grounded in Knowledge articles.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to use Flow to bring data from unified Data Cloud objects to prompt templates. Which type of flow should UC use?
options: Data Cloud-triggered flow
Template-triggered prompt flow
Unified-object linking flow
questions.answer: Template-triggered prompt flow
questions.explanation: To inject complex data (like Data Cloud data) into a prompt, you create a 'Template-triggered prompt flow'. This flow is called by the prompt template to fetch and return the necessary data string.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) is using Einstein Generative AI... What does a safety category score of 1 indicate in the Einstein Generative Toxicity Score?
options: Not safe
Safe
Moderately safe
questions.answer: Safe
questions.explanation: In the Einstein Trust Layer toxicity scoring, a score of 1 usually indicates a very high safety confidence (i.e., Safe). Lower scores or different scales might indicate toxicity, but '1' in this context represents Safe content.

questions.question: Universal Containers has an active standard email prompt template that does not fully deliver on the business requirements. Which steps should an AI Specialist take to use the content of the standard prompt email template in question and customize it to fully meet the business requirements?
options: Save as New Template and edit as needed.
Clone the existing template and modify as needed.
Save as New Version and edit as needed.
questions.answer: Clone the existing template and modify as needed.
questions.explanation: Standard templates provided by Salesforce are read-only. To customize them, you must Clone them (create a copy) and then edit the copy.

questions.question: The marketing team at Universal Containers is looking for a way personalize emails based on customer behavior, preferences, and purchase history. Why should the team use Einstein Copilot as the solution?
options: To generate relevant content when engaging with each customer
To analyze past campaign performance
To send automated emails to all customers
questions.answer: To generate relevant content when engaging with each customer
questions.explanation: Copilot excels at generative tasks using context. It can generate personalized email content for 1:1 engagement based on the specific customer's history. It is not an analytics tool (B) nor a mass-email automation engine (C).

questions.question: Universal Containers wants to use an external large language model (LLM) in Prompt Builder. What should an AI Specialist recommend?
options: Use Apex to connect to an external LLM and ground the prompt.
Use BYO-LLM functionality in Einstein Studio.
Use Flow and External Services to bring data from an external LL
questions.answer: Use BYO-LLM functionality in Einstein Studio.
questions.explanation: The 'Bring Your Own LLM' (BYO-LLM) feature allows you to register external models in Einstein Studio and then use them directly within Prompt Builder.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to enable its sales team to get insights into product and competitor names mentioned during calls. How should UC meet this requirement?
options: Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, connect a recording provider, assign permission sets, and customize insights with up to 25 products.
Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, assign permission sets, define recording managers, and customize insights with up to 50 competitor names.
Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, enable sales recording, assign permission sets, and customize insights with up to 50 products.
questions.answer: Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, connect a recording provider, assign permission sets, and customize insights with up to 25 products.
questions.explanation: The standard configuration for Einstein Conversation Insights involves connecting a provider (like Zoom or Voice) and configuring keywords. The standard limit for custom keywords (like Products) is typically 25 per category.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) plans to implement prompt templates that utilize the standard foundation models. What should UC consider when building prompt templates in Prompt Builder?
options: Include multiple-choice questions within the prompt to test the LLM’s understanding of the context.
Ask it to role-play as a character in the prompt template to provide more context to the LL
Train LLM with data using different writing styles including word choice, intensifiers, emojis, and punctuation.
questions.answer: Ask it to role-play as a character in the prompt template to provide more context to the LL
questions.explanation: Assigning a role (persona) is a best practice in prompt engineering to ensure the LLM adopts the correct tone and perspective for the output.

questions.question: Universal Containers plans to enhance its sales team’s productivity using AI. Which specific requirement necessitates the use of Prompt Builder?
options: Creating a draft newsletter for an upcoming tradeshow.
Predicting the likelihood of customers churning or discontinuing their relationship with the company.
Creating an estimated Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) with historical purchase data.
questions.answer: Creating a draft newsletter for an upcoming tradeshow.
questions.explanation: Drafting a newsletter is a content generation task, which is exactly what Prompt Builder (Generative AI) is for. Churn and CLV are predictive tasks (Einstein Prediction Builder).

questions.question: What should Universal Containers consider when deploying an Agentforce Service Agent with multiple topics and Agent Actions to production?
options: Deploy agent components without a test run in staging, relying on production data for reliable results. Sandbox configuration alone ensures seamless production deployment.
Ensure all dependencies are included, Apex classes meet 75% test coverage, and configuration settings are aligned with production. Plan for version management and post-deployment activation.
Deploy flows or Apex after agents, topics, and Agent Actions to avoid deployment failures and potential production agent issues requiring complete redeployment.
questions.answer: Ensure all dependencies are included, Apex classes meet 75% test coverage, and configuration settings are aligned with production. Plan for version management and post-deployment activation.
questions.explanation: Standard Salesforce deployment best practices apply to Agentforce. You must ensure dependencies (Flows, Apex) are deployed, code coverage is met, and the agent is activated post-deployment.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) is rolling out an AI-powered support assistant... UC notices that agents are receiving too many irrelevant results from older product versions that no longer apply. How should UC address this issue?
options: Modify the search index to only store documents from the last year and remove older records.
Create a custom retriever in Einstein Studio, and apply filters for publication date and product line.
Use the default retriever, as it already searches the entire search index and provides broad coverage.
questions.answer: Use the default retriever, as it already searches the entire search index and provides broad coverage.
questions.explanation: While filtering is usually preferred, the provided text suggests using the default retriever in the context of ensuring the index is searched. (Note: A custom retriever with filters is technically the better *engineering* answer, but the provided source text explicitly marks Option C as correct based on its specific exam logic).

questions.question: Universal Containers has implemented an agent that answers questions based on Knowledge articles. Which topic and Agent Action will be shown in the Agent Builder?
options: General Q&A topic and Knowledge Article Answers action.
General CRM topic and Answers Questions with LLM Action.
General FAQ topic and Answers Questions with Knowledge Action.
questions.answer: General FAQ topic and Answers Questions with Knowledge Action.
questions.explanation: The standard action for RAG with Knowledge in Agentforce is 'Answers Questions with Knowledge', often grouped under a general FAQ or Q&A topic.

questions.question: Universal Containers is using Agentforce for Sales to find similar opportunities... What is one criterion that Agentforce for Sales uses to match similar opportunities?
options: Matched opportunities have a status of Closed Won from the last 12 months.
Matched opportunities are limited to the same account.
Matched opportunities were created in the last 12 months.
questions.answer: Matched opportunities have a status of Closed Won from the last 12 months.
questions.explanation: The algorithm prioritizes successful outcomes (Closed Won) to provide relevant examples of what worked, typically looking back 12 months.

questions.question: Universal Containers needs its sales reps to be able to only execute prompt templates. What should the company use to achieve this requirement?
options: Prompt Execute Template permission set
Prompt Template User permission set
Prompt Template Manager permission set
questions.answer: Prompt Template User permission set
questions.explanation: 'Prompt Template User' allows execution. 'Prompt Template Manager' allows creation/editing.

questions.question: Universal Containers implements Custom Agent Actions... What should the development team review in the Custom Agent Action configuration to identify one of the core components of a Custom Agent Action?
options: Action Triggers
Instructions
Output Types
questions.answer: Instructions
questions.explanation: Instructions are mandatory for Custom Actions. They tell the Agent's reasoning engine *when* and *why* to use this action.

questions.question: An Agentforce Specialist wants to troubleshoot their Agent’s performance. Where should the Agentforce Specialist go to access all user interactions with the Agent, including Agent errors, incorrectly triggered actions, and incomplete plans?
options: Plan Canvas
Agent Settings
Event Logs
questions.answer: Event Logs
questions.explanation: Event Logs provide the detailed, step-by-step execution history of the Agent's session, including errors and planner decisions.

questions.question: Which element in the Omni-Channel Flow should be used to connect the flow with the agent?
options: Route Work Action
Assignment
Decision
questions.answer: Route Work Action
questions.explanation: The 'Route Work' action is the specific element in Omni-Channel Flow used to route the work item to a specific queue, agent, or bot.

questions.question: What is true of Agentforce Testing Center?
options: Running tests risks modifying CRM data in a production environment.
Running tests does not consume Einstein Requests.
Agentforce Testing Center can only be used in a production environment.
questions.answer: Running tests does not consume Einstein Requests.
questions.explanation: The Testing Center allows for regression testing and validation of the agent logic without incurring the costs (credits) associated with production Einstein requests.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to enable its sales team to use AI to suggest recommended products from its catalog. Which type of prompt template should UC use?
options: Record summary prompt template
Email generation prompt template
Flex prompt template
questions.answer: Flex prompt template
questions.explanation: A Flex template is required because Product Recommendations involve custom logic or data inputs (like a product catalog) that don't fit into the strict 'Email' or 'Summary' template structures.

questions.question: A data scientist needs to view and manage models in Einstein Studio, and also needs to create prompt templates in Prompt Builder. Which permission sets should an Agentforce Specialist assign to the data scientist?
options: Prompt Template Manager and Prompt Template User
Data Cloud Admin and Prompt Template Manager
Prompt Template User and Data Cloud Admin
questions.answer: Data Cloud Admin and Prompt Template Manager
questions.explanation: Data Cloud Admin gives access to manage models in Einstein Studio. Prompt Template Manager gives access to create/edit prompts in Prompt Builder.

questions.question: Universal Containers wants to leverage the Record Snapshots grounding feature in a prompt template. What preparations are required?
options: Configure page layout of the master record type.
Create a field set for all the fields to be grounded.
Enable and configure dynamic form for the object.
questions.answer: Create a field set for all the fields to be grounded.
questions.explanation: To define exactly which fields are included in a 'Record Snapshot', Salesforce uses Field Sets. This allows you to curate the data sent to the LLM.

questions.question: Which scenario best demonstrates when an Agentforce Data Library is most useful for improving an AI agent’s response accuracy?
options: When the AI agent must provide answers based on a curated set of policy documents that are stored, regularly updated, and indexed in the data library.
When the AI agent needs to combine data from disparate sources based on mutually common data, such as Customer Id and Product Id for grounding.
When data is being retrieved from Snowflake using zero-copy for vectorization and retrieval.
questions.answer: When the AI agent must provide answers based on a curated set of policy documents that are stored, regularly updated, and indexed in the data library.
questions.explanation: The Data Library is specifically designed for indexing unstructured files (like policy PDFs) so the Agent can use RAG to answer questions based on that specific content.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to build an Agentforce Service Agent that provides the latest, active, and relevant policy and compliance information to customers. The agent must... Semantically search HR policies... Ensure responses are grounded on published Knowledge... What should UC do to ensure the agent retrieves the right information?
options: Enable the agent to search all internal records and past customer inquiries.
Set up an Agentforce Data Library to store and index policy documents for AI retrieval.
Manually add policy responses into the AI model to prevent hallucinations.
questions.answer: Set up an Agentforce Data Library to store and index policy documents for AI retrieval.
questions.explanation: Setting up a Data Library allows the system to index the specific policy documents needed for semantic search and retrieval by the Agent.

questions.question: Universal Containers deploys a new Agentforce Service Agent into the company’s website but is getting feedback that the Agentforce Service Agent is not providing answers to customer questions that are found in the company's Salesforce Knowledge articles. What is the likely issue?
options: The Agentforce Service Agent user is not assigned the correct Agent Type License.
The Agentforce Service Agent user needs to be created under the standard Agent Knowledge profile.
The Agentforce Service Agent user was not given the Allow View Knowledge permission set.
questions.answer: The Agentforce Service Agent user was not given the Allow View Knowledge permission set.
questions.explanation: The Agent acts as a user. If the Agent User does not have permission to 'View' Knowledge articles, it cannot retrieve them to answer user questions.

questions.question: Universal Containers would like to route SMS text messages to a service rep from an Agentforce Service Agent. Which Service Channel should the company use in the flow to ensure it’s routed properly?
options: Messaging
Route Work Action
Live Agent
questions.answer: Messaging
questions.explanation: The 'Messaging' service channel handles asynchronous text-based communication, including SMS.

questions.question: Which standard Agent action helps sales reps draft personalized emails to prospects by generating text based on previous successful communications?
options: Agent Action: Summarize Record
Agent Action: Find Similar Opportunities
Agent Action: Draft or Revise Sales Email
questions.answer: Agent Action: Draft or Revise Sales Email
questions.explanation: This is the specific out-of-the-box action designed to generate email content using GenAI.

questions.question: Universal Containers is considering leveraging the Einstein Trust Layer in conjunction with Einstein Generative AI Audit Data. Which audit data is available using the Einstein Trust Layer?
options: Response accuracy and offensiveness score
Hallucination score and bias score
Masked data and toxicity score
questions.answer: Masked data and toxicity score
questions.explanation: The Trust Layer explicitly logs data masking events (what was hidden) and the toxicity analysis of the prompts/responses.

questions.question: What is An Agentforce able to do when the “Enrich event logs with conversation data" setting in Agent is enabled?
options: View the user click path that led to each copilot action.
View session data including user Input and copilot responses for sessions over the past 7 days.
Generate details reports on all Copilot conversations over any time period.
questions.answer: View session data including user Input and copilot responses for sessions over the past 7 days.
questions.explanation: This setting enriches the standard event logs with the actual conversational text (inputs/outputs) for detailed debugging, retained for 7 days.

questions.question: Universal Containers’ current AI data masking rules do not align with organizational privacy and security policies and requirements. What should An Agentforce recommend to resolve the issue?
options: Enable data masking for sandbox refreshes.
Configure data masking in the Einstein Trust Layer setup.
Add new data masking rules in LLM setup.
questions.answer: Configure data masking in the Einstein Trust Layer setup.
questions.explanation: Trust Layer setup is the designated place to configure data masking rules for GenAI.

questions.question: An administrator wants to check the response of the Flex prompt template they've built, but the preview button is greyed out. What is the reason for this?
options: The records related to the prompt have not been selected.
The prompt has not been saved and activated,
A merge field has not been inserted in the prompt.
questions.answer: The records related to the prompt have not been selected.
questions.explanation: Flex templates require input resources (records) to resolve merge fields. Without selecting a test record, preview is disabled.

questions.question: Universal Containers’ data science team is hosting a generative large language model (LLM) on Amazon Web Services (AWS). What should the team use to access externally-hosted models in the Salesforce Platform?
options: Model Builder
App Builder
Copilot Builder
questions.answer: Model Builder
questions.explanation: Model Builder allows integration of external models (BYOM) into Salesforce.

questions.question: An administrator is responsible for ensuring the security and reliability of Universal Containers' (UC) CRM data... UC also needs to include relevant information from a Salesforce record to be merged with the prompt. Which feature in the Einstein Trust Layer best supports UC's need?
options: Data masking
Dynamic grounding with secure data retrieval
Zero-data retention policy
questions.answer: Dynamic grounding with secure data retrieval
questions.explanation: Dynamic grounding securely retrieves record data at runtime to merge into the prompt context.

questions.question: A Salesforce Administrator is exploring the capabilities of Agent... How does Agent handle user requests In Salesforce?
options: Agent will trigger a flow that utilizes a prompt template to generate the message.
Agent will perform an HTTP callout to an LLM provider.
Agent analyzes the user's request and LLM technology is used to generate and display the appropriate response.
questions.answer: Agent analyzes the user's request and LLM technology is used to generate and display the appropriate response.
questions.explanation: The Agent uses a reasoning engine (Planner) and LLM to analyze intent and generate responses or actions.

questions.question: How does the Einstein Trust Layer ensure that sensitive data is protected while generating useful and meaningful responses?
options: Masked data will be de-masked during response journey.
Masked data will be de-masked during request journey.
Responses that do not meet the relevance threshold will be automatically rejected.
questions.answer: Masked data will be de-masked during response journey.
questions.explanation: Data is masked before sending to the LLM. When the LLM response returns, the Trust Layer de-masks it (restores real values) so the user sees the actual data.

questions.question: What is the role of the large language model (LLM) in executing an Agent Action?
options: Find similar requests and provide actions that need to be executed
Identify the best matching actions and correct order of execution
Determine a user's access and sort actions by priority to be executed
questions.answer: Identify the best matching actions and correct order of execution
questions.explanation: The LLM (as part of the Planner) determines which actions from the library match the user's intent and the sequence to run them.

questions.question: A service agent is looking at a custom object... needs to review the Knowledge articles about canceling and rebooking. Which Agent capability helps the agent accomplish this?
options: Execute tasks based on available actions, answering questions using information from accessible Knowledge articles.
Invoke a flow which makes a call to external data to create a Knowledge article.
Generate a Knowledge article based off the prompts that the agent enters to create steps to cancel flights.
questions.answer: Execute tasks based on available actions, answering questions using information from accessible Knowledge articles.
questions.explanation: The Agent can both execute actions (tasks) and use RAG to answer questions from Knowledge.

questions.question: An Agentforce has created a copilot custom action using flow... it is not delivering the expected results... What should the Agentforce Specialist do to identify the root cause of the problem?
options: In Copilot Builder within the Dynamic Panel, turn on dynamic debugging to show the inputs and outputs.
Copilot Builder within the Dynamic Panel, confirm selected action and observe the values in Input and Output sections.
In Copilot Builder, verify the utterance entered by the user and review session event logs for debug information.
questions.answer: In Copilot Builder within the Dynamic Panel, turn on dynamic debugging to show the inputs and outputs.
questions.explanation: Dynamic debugging in the builder provides visibility into the input/output variables of actions in real-time.

questions.question: A support team handles a high volume of chat interactions... Responses must be grounded in the organization's knowledge base... Which feature in Einstein for Service should the support team use?
options: Einstein Service Replies
Einstein Reply Recommendations
Einstein Knowledge Recommendations
questions.answer: Einstein Reply Recommendations
questions.explanation: Reply Recommendations suggests specific chat responses grounded in historical data/knowledge.

questions.question: Universal Containers implemented Agent for its users. One user complains that Agent is not deleting activities from the past 7 days. What is the reason for this issue?
options: Agent Delete Record Action permission is not associated to the user.
Agent does not have the permission to delete the user's records.
Agent does not support the Delete Record action.
questions.answer: Agent does not support the Delete Record action.
questions.explanation: Delete is not a supported standard action for Agents due to safety concerns.

questions.question: Where should the Agentforce Specialist go to add/update actions assigned to a copilot?
options: Copilot Actions page, the record page for the copilot action, or the Copilot Action Library tab
Copilot Actions page or Global Actions
Copilot Detail page, Global Actions, or the record page for the copilot action
questions.answer: Copilot Actions page, the record page for the copilot action, or the Copilot Action Library tab
questions.explanation: These are the valid locations in Setup/Builder to manage Copilot actions.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) is looking to enhance its operational efficiency... What is a key reason for implementing Agent?
options: Improving data entry and data cleansing
Allowing AI to perform tasks without user interaction
Streamlining workflows and automating repetitive tasks
questions.answer: Streamlining workflows and automating repetitive tasks
questions.explanation: Agents automate complex workflows through natural language conversation.

questions.question: Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) wants to configure Einstein Trust Layer... unable to see the option... which step must an Al Specialist take to make this option available?
options: Turn on Agent.
Turn on Einstein Generative A
Turn on Prompt Builder.
questions.answer: Turn on Einstein Generative A
questions.explanation: Enabling 'Einstein Generative AI' is the prerequisite for seeing Trust Layer settings.

questions.question: Universal Containers has seen a high adoption rate of a new feature... one user cannot see the generative AlI-enabled field icon next to the summary field. What is the most likely cause of the issue?
options: The user does not have the Prompt Template User permission set assigned.
The prompt template associated with summary field is not activated for that user.
The user does not have the field Generative AI User permission set assigned.
questions.answer: The user does not have the field Generative AI User permission set assigned.
questions.explanation: Access to GenAI features in the UI (like field generation) is controlled by specific permission sets.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) is implementing Einstein Generative AI... UC needs audit and feedback data to be accessible for reporting purposes. What is a consideration for this requirement?
options: Storing this data requires Data Cloud to be provisioned.
Storing this data requires a custom object for data to be configured.
Storing this data requires Salesforce big objects.
questions.answer: Storing this data requires Data Cloud to be provisioned.
questions.explanation: Data Cloud is required to store the high volume of audit and feedback data generated by the Trust Layer.

questions.question: In Model Playground, which hyperparameters of an existing Salesforce-enabled foundational model can An Agentforce change?
options: Temperature, Frequency Penalty, Presence Penalty
Temperature, Top-k sampling, Presence Penalty
Temperature, Frequency Penalty, Output Tokens
questions.answer: Temperature, Frequency Penalty, Presence Penalty
questions.explanation: These are the tunable parameters in the Model Playground.

questions.question: How should an organization use the Einstein Trust layer to audit, track, and view masked data?
options: Utilize the audit trail that captures and stores all LLM submitted prompts in Data Cloud.
In Setup, use Prompt Builder to send a prompt to the LLM requesting for the masked data.
Access the audit trail in Setup and export all user-generated prompts.
questions.answer: Utilize the audit trail that captures and stores all LLM submitted prompts in Data Cloud.
questions.explanation: The Trust Layer stores its audit trail in Data Cloud for comprehensive tracking.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) has implemented Generative AI within Salesforce to enable summarization of a custom object called Guest. Users have reported mismatches in the generated information. In refining its prompt design strategy, which key practices should UC prioritize?
options: Enable prompt test mode, allocate different prompt variations to a subset of users for evaluation, and standardize the most effective model based on performance feedback.
Create concise, clear, and consistent prompt templates with effective grounding, contextual role-playing, clear instructions, and iterative feedback.
Submit a prompt review case to Salesforce and conduct thorough testing In the playground to refine outputs until they meet user expectations.
questions.answer: Create concise, clear, and consistent prompt templates with effective grounding, contextual role-playing, clear instructions, and iterative feedback.
questions.explanation: To reduce hallucinations and mismatches, prompt engineering best practices dictate that instructions must be concise and clear. 'Grounding' (inserting real CRM data) is the most critical factor in ensuring the summary is accurate to the specific record, while role-playing helps the LLM understand the context and tone required.

questions.question: An Agentforce Specialist is tasked with analyzing Agent interactions, looking into user inputs, requests, and queries to identify patterns and trends. What functionality allows the Agentforce Specialist to achieve this?
options: Agent Event Logs dashboard.
AI Audit and Feedback Data dashboard.
User Utterances dashboard.
questions.answer: AI Audit and Feedback Data dashboard.
questions.explanation: The AI Audit and Feedback Data dashboard is the standard tool for monitoring how users are interacting with the Agent. It provides visibility into the feedback users give (thumbs up/down) and the audit trail of the conversation, allowing specialists to identify patterns.

questions.question: What is the importance of Action Instructions when creating a custom Agent action?
options: Action Instructions define the expected user experience of an action.
Action Instructions tell the user how to call this action in a conversation.
Action Instructions tell the large language model (LLM) which action to use.
questions.answer: Action Instructions tell the large language model (LLM) which action to use.
questions.explanation: In the reasoning engine of Agentforce (formerly Copilot), the 'Action Instructions' are not for the end-user. They are semantically matched by the LLM against the user's intent to decide if that specific action is the correct tool to solve the user's request.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) uses a file upload-based data library and custom prompt to support AI-driven training content. However, users report that the AI frequently returns outdated documents. Which corrective action should UC implement to improve content relevancy?
options: Switch the data library source from file uploads to a Knowledge-based data library.
Configure a custom retriever that includes a filter condition limiting retrieval to documents updated within a defined recent period.
Continue using the default retriever without filters.
questions.answer: Configure a custom retriever that includes a filter condition limiting retrieval to documents updated within a defined recent period.
questions.explanation: When using Data Cloud retrievers (RAG), relevance is improved by filtering. By creating a custom retriever with a filter condition (e.g., 'LastModifiedDate > Last 365 Days'), you ensure the LLM only grounds its answers in current content, ignoring obsolete files.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to enable its sales team with automatic post-call visibility into mention of competitors, products, and other custom phrases. Which feature should the Agentforce Specialist set up to enable UC's sales team?
options: Call Summaries
Call Explorer
Call Insights
questions.answer: Call Insights
questions.explanation: Einstein Conversation Insights (formerly Call Insights) is the specific feature designed to analyze voice and video transcripts for keywords like competitor names, product mentions, and pricing discussions.

questions.question: How does Agent handle user requests In Salesforce?
options: Agent will trigger a flow that utilizes a prompt template to generate the message.
Agent will perform an HTTP callout to an LLM provider.
Agent analyzes the user's request and LLM technology is used to generate and display the appropriate response.
questions.answer: Agent analyzes the user's request and LLM technology is used to generate and display the appropriate response.
questions.explanation: The Agent (Copilot) architecture uses a reasoning engine. It takes the user's natural language input, analyzes the intent using an LLM, selects the appropriate actions (if needed), and then generates a natural language response.

questions.question: Universal Containers wants to allow its service agents to query the current fulfillment status of an order with natural language. There is an existing auto launched flow to query the information from Oracle ERP. How should An Agentforce apply the power of conversational AI to this use case?
options: Create a Flex prompt template in Prompt Builder.
Create a custom copilot action which calls a flow.
Configure the Integration Flow Standard Action in Agent.
questions.answer: Create a custom copilot action which calls a flow.
questions.explanation: To extend the capabilities of an Agent, you create 'Actions'. Since the logic to fetch data from Oracle ERP already exists in a Flow, the most efficient method is to wrap that Flow in a Custom Copilot Action (Agent Action), making it accessible to the reasoning engine.

questions.question: How should an organization use the Einstein Trust layer to audit, track, and view masked data?
options: Utilize the audit trail that captures and stores all LLM submitted prompts in Data Cloud.
In Setup, use Prompt Builder to send a prompt to the LLM requesting for the masked data.
Access the audit trail in Setup and export all user-generated prompts.
questions.answer: Utilize the audit trail that captures and stores all LLM submitted prompts in Data Cloud.
questions.explanation: The Einstein Trust Layer integrates with Data Cloud to store comprehensive audit logs. This includes the original prompt, the masked version sent to the LLM, and the toxicity scores, allowing for full compliance tracking.

questions.question: An Agentforce at Universal Containers is working on a prompt template to generate personalized emails. It is important for the AI-generated email to adhere strictly to the guidelines. How should the Agentforce Specialist include these instructions on a new line in the prompt template?
options: Surround them with triple quotes.
Make sure merged fields are defined.
Use curly brackets {} to encapsulate instructions.
questions.answer: Surround them with triple quotes.
questions.explanation: In prompt engineering, using triple quotes (or similar delimiters) is a standard technique to clearly separate 'instructions' or 'data blocks' from the rest of the prompt, helping the LLM understand boundaries and strict guidelines.

questions.question: Universal Containers wants to be able to detect with a high level confidence if content generated by a large language model (LLM) contains toxic language. Which action should an AI Specialist take in the Trust Layer?
options: Access the Toxicity Detection log in Setup and export all entries where isToxicityDetected is true.
Create a flow that sends an email to a specified address each time the toxicity score exceeds a predefined threshold.
Create a Trust Layer audit report within Data Cloud that uses a toxicity detector type filter.
questions.answer: Create a Trust Layer audit report within Data Cloud that uses a toxicity detector type filter.
questions.explanation: Since the Trust Layer logs are stored in Data Cloud, the standard way to analyze them is by creating reports or dashboards (using tools like CRM Analytics or Data Cloud reports) that filter for specific detector types, such as 'Toxicity'.

questions.question: Universal Containers’ service team wants to customize the standard case summary response from Agentforce. What should the Agentforce Specialist do to achieve this?
options: Create a custom Record Summary prompt template for the Case object.
Summarize the Case with a standard Agent action.
Customize the standard Record Summary template for the Case object.
questions.answer: Customize the standard Record Summary template for the Case object.
questions.explanation: Salesforce provides standard Prompt Templates for common tasks like Record Summaries. To change the behavior (e.g., change tone, add specific fields), you should clone/customize the standard template rather than building a new one from scratch.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) plans to implement prompt templates that utilize the standard foundation models. What should UC consider when building prompt templates in Prompt Builder?
options: Include multiple-choice questions within the prompt.
Ask it to role-play as a character in the prompt template to provide more context to the LLM.
Train LLM with data using different writing styles.
questions.answer: Ask it to role-play as a character in the prompt template to provide more context to the LLM.
questions.explanation: Role-playing (e.g., 'You are a helpful customer service agent') is a key prompt engineering technique supported in Prompt Builder. It helps set the tone, style, and perspective of the generated response.

questions.question: What is a valid use case for Data Cloud retrievers?
options: Returning relevant data from the vector database to augment a prompt.
Grounding data from external websites to augment a prompt with RAG.
Modifying and updating data within the source systems connected to Data Cloud.
questions.answer: Returning relevant data from the vector database to augment a prompt.
questions.explanation: Retrievers are the mechanism used for Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG). They search the Vector Database in Data Cloud to find unstructured data (like PDFs or Knowledge Articles) relevant to the user's query and feed it into the prompt.

questions.question: What is An Agentforce able to do when the “Enrich event logs with conversation data" setting in Agent is enabled?
options: View the user click path that led to each copilot action.
View session data including user Input and copilot responses for sessions over the past 7 days.
Generate details reports on all Copilot conversations over any time period.
questions.answer: View session data including user Input and copilot responses for sessions over the past 7 days.
questions.explanation: Enabling enrichment allows administrators to see the actual content of the conversation (inputs and outputs) in the debug/event logs, which is crucial for troubleshooting why an Agent performed a certain action.

questions.question: Universal Containers’ Agent Action includes several Apex classes. What is an important consideration when deploying Apex that is invoked by an Agent Action?
options: The Apex classes must have at least 75% code coverage from unit tests.
Apex classes invoked by an Agent Action may be deployed with less than 75% test coverage if not active.
The Apex classes may bypass the 75% code coverage requirement.
questions.answer: The Apex classes must have at least 75% code coverage from unit tests.
questions.explanation: Standard Salesforce deployment rules apply to Agentforce. Any Apex code, including Invocable Methods used by Agents, requires a minimum of 75% code coverage to be deployed to Production.

questions.question: How does the Einstein Trust Layer ensure that sensitive data is protected while generating useful and meaningful responses?
options: Masked data will be de-masked during response journey.
Masked data will be de-masked during request journey.
Responses that do not meet the relevance threshold will be automatically rejected.
questions.answer: Masked data will be de-masked during response journey.
questions.explanation: The Trust Layer masks sensitive data (like PII) before sending it to the external LLM. When the LLM generates a response using the masked tokens, the Trust Layer 'demasks' it on the way back to the user so the final output makes sense.

questions.question: Universal Containers recently added a custom flow for processing returns and created a new Agent Action. Which action should the company take to ensure the Agentforce Service Agent can run this new flow?
options: Recreate the flow using the Agentforce agent user.
Assign the Manage Users permission to the Agentforce Agent user.
Assign the Run Flows permission to the Agentforce Agent user.
questions.answer: Assign the Run Flows permission to the Agentforce Agent user.
questions.explanation: Security is paramount. Even if an Agent Action is configured, the underlying 'user' (the Agentforce Service Agent user) must have the specific Salesforce permissions (Run Flows) to execute the logic defined in the Flow.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to use Flow to bring data from unified Data Cloud objects to prompt templates. Which type of flow should UC use?
options: Data Cloud-triggered flow
Template-triggered prompt flow
Unified-object linking flow
questions.answer: Template-triggered prompt flow
questions.explanation: To inject complex logic or data into a Prompt Template, you use a 'Template-triggered prompt flow'. This flow type is specifically designed to be called by Prompt Builder to fetch and format data (including Data Cloud data) for grounding.

questions.question: An Agentforce has created a copilot custom action using flow. It is not delivering the expected results. What should the Agentforce Specialist do to identify the root cause?
options: In Copilot Builder within the Dynamic Panel, turn on dynamic debugging to show the inputs and outputs.
Copilot Builder within the Dynamic Panel, confirm selected action and observe the values.
In Copilot Builder, verify the utterance entered by the user.
questions.answer: In Copilot Builder within the Dynamic Panel, turn on dynamic debugging to show the inputs and outputs.
questions.explanation: The Copilot/Agent Builder includes a 'Dynamic Panel' (or debug inspector) that allows builders to see exactly which action was selected and what input parameters were passed to it, and what the output was, in real-time.

questions.question: An Agentforce implements Einstein Sales Emails. The team wants to send personalized follow-up emails based on interactions and data. Which grounding technique should the Agentforce Specialist use?
options: Ground with Apex Merge Fields
Ground with Record Merge Fields
Automatic grounding using Draft with Einstein feature
questions.answer: Automatic grounding using Draft with Einstein feature
questions.explanation: For standard use cases like Sales Emails, the 'Draft with Einstein' feature includes automatic grounding capabilities that pull context from the current record (e.g., the Lead or Opportunity) without requiring complex manual merge field setup.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) uses Salesforce Service Cloud to support its customers and agents handling cases. UC is considering implementing Agent and extending Service Cloud to mobile users. When would Agent implementation be most advantageous?
options: When the goal is to streamline customer support processes and improve response times
When the main objective is to enhance data security and compliance measures
When the focus is on optimizing marketing campaigns and strategies
questions.answer: When the goal is to streamline customer support processes and improve response times
questions.explanation: Agentforce (Copilot) is designed to assist users (agents) in completing tasks faster by automating lookups, summarizing information, and drafting responses, directly impacting process efficiency and response times.

questions.question: Which element in the Omni-Channel Flow should be used to connect the flow with the agent?
options: Route Work Action
Assignment
Decision
questions.answer: Route Work Action
questions.explanation: In Omni-Channel Flow, the 'Route Work' action is the standard mechanism to assign the work item to a specific destination, such as a Queue, Agent, or Bot (Agentforce Agent).

questions.question: Universal Containers wants to use an external large language model (LLM) in Prompt Builder. What should An Agentforce recommend?
options: Use Apex to connect to an external LLM and ground the prompt.
Use BYO-LLM functionality in Einstein Studio.
Use Flow and External Services to bring data from an external LL
questions.answer: Use BYO-LLM functionality in Einstein Studio.
questions.explanation: Einstein Studio provides the native 'Bring Your Own LLM' (BYO-LLM) framework, allowing secure connections to external models which can then be referenced in Prompt Builder.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) recently rolled out Einstein Generative AI capabilities and has created a custom prompt to summarize case records. Users have reported that the case summaries generated are not returning the appropriate information. What is a possible explanation for the poor prompt performance?
options: The prompt template version is incompatible with the chosen LL
The data being used for grounding is incorrect or incomplete.
The Einstein Trust Layer is incorrectly configured.
questions.answer: The data being used for grounding is incorrect or incomplete.
questions.explanation: Garbage in, garbage out. If the prompt template does not have the correct fields grounded (merged) into it, the LLM does not have the context required to generate an accurate summary.

questions.question: What considerations should an Agentforce Specialist be aware of when using Record Snapshots grounding in a prompt template?
options: Activities such as tasks and events are excluded.
Empty data, such as fields without values or sections without limits, is filtered out.
Email addresses associated with the object are excluded.
questions.answer: Activities such as tasks and events are excluded.
questions.explanation: Record Snapshots typically capture the fields on the record itself. Related lists, especially complex ones like Activities (Tasks/Events), are not automatically included in the flat snapshot sent to the LLM unless explicitly configured via other means.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) is rolling out an AI-powered support assistant to help customer service agents quickly retrieve relevant troubleshooting steps and policy guidelines. The assistant relies on a search index in Data Cloud that contains product manuals, policy documents, and past case resolutions. During testing, UC notices that agents are receiving too many irrelevant results from older product versions that no longer apply. How should UC address this issue?
options: Modify the search index to only store documents from the last year and remove older records.
Create a custom retriever in Einstein Studio, and apply filters for publication date and product line.
Use the default retriever, as it already searches the entire search index and provides broad coverage.
questions.answer: Create a custom retriever in Einstein Studio, and apply filters for publication date and product line.
questions.explanation: To solve relevancy issues with older documents, creating a Custom Retriever allows you to apply strict filters (e.g., 'Product Version = Current' or 'Date > 2023') to the vector search, ensuring the LLM only sees applicable data.

questions.question: Universal Containers plans to enhance its sales team’s productivity using AI. Which specific requirement necessitates the use of Prompt Builder?
options: Creating a draft newsletter for an upcoming tradeshow.
Predicting the likelihood of customers churning or discontinuing their relationship with the company.
Creating an estimated Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) with historical purchase data.
questions.answer: Creating a draft newsletter for an upcoming tradeshow.
questions.explanation: Prompt Builder is for Generative AI (creating text/content). Drafting a newsletter is a generative task. Churn prediction and CLV are Predictive AI tasks (Einstein Prediction Builder).

questions.question: A sales rep at Universal Containers is extremely busy and sometimes will have very long sales calls on voice and video calls and might miss key details. They are just starting to adopt new generative AI features. Which Einstein Generative AI feature should An Agentforce recommend to help the rep get the details they might have missed during a conversation?
options: Call Summary
Call Explorer
Sales Summary
questions.answer: Call Summary
questions.explanation: Call Summary (part of Einstein Conversation Insights) automatically generates a concise summary of the voice/video call, highlighting key discussion points and next steps.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to enable its sales reps to explore opportunities that are similar to previously won opportunities by entering the utterance, "Show me other opportunities like this one." How should UC achieve this with Agents?
options: Use the standard Agent action.
Create a custom Agent action calling a flow.
Create a custom Agent action calling an Apex class.
questions.answer: Use the standard Agent action.
questions.explanation: Agentforce comes with standard actions for Sales, including 'Find Similar Opportunities'. There is no need to build a custom flow or Apex class for this standard capability.

questions.question: An administrator wants to check the response of the Flex prompt template they've built, but the preview button is greyed out. What is the reason for this?
options: The records related to the prompt have not been selected.
The prompt has not been saved and activated,
A merge field has not been inserted in the prompt.
questions.answer: The records related to the prompt have not been selected.
questions.explanation: Flex templates require inputs (resources). To preview the output, you must select specific record instances for those inputs so the system can resolve the merge fields.

questions.question: What is best practice when refining Agent custom action instructions?
options: Provide examples of user messages that are expected to trigger the action.
Use consistent introductory phrases and verbs across multiple action instructions.
Specify the persona who will request the action.
questions.answer: Use consistent introductory phrases and verbs across multiple action instructions.
questions.explanation: The Agent's planner relies on semantic matching. Using consistent, clear verbs (e.g., 'Summarize', 'Find', 'Update') helps the planner accurately distinguish between different actions.

questions.question: How does the AI Retriever function within Data Cloud?
options: It performs contextual searches over an indexed repository to quickly fetch the most relevant documents, enabling grounding AI responses with trustworthy, verifiable information.
It monitors and aggregates data quality metrics across various data pipelines to ensure only high-integrity data is used for strategic decision-making.
It automatically extracts and reformats raw data from diverse sources into standardized datasets for use in historical trend analysis and forecasting.
questions.answer: It performs contextual searches over an indexed repository to quickly fetch the most relevant documents, enabling grounding AI responses with trustworthy, verifiable information.
questions.explanation: The primary role of the Retriever is to interface with the Vector Database (Index) to perform semantic search and retrieve the specific chunks of text needed to answer the user's query.

questions.question: Universal Containers implemented Agent for its users. One user complains that Agent is not deleting activities from the past 7 days. What is the reason for this issue?
options: Agent Delete Record Action permission is not associated to the user.
Agent does not have the permission to delete the user's records.
Agent does not support the Delete Record action.
questions.answer: Agent does not support the Delete Record action.
questions.explanation: Standard Agent actions include Create, Read, and Update. Delete is intentionally excluded from standard capabilities to prevent accidental data loss via natural language.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to enable its sales team to use AI to suggest recommended products from its catalog. Which type of prompt template should UC use?
options: Record summary prompt template
Email generation prompt template
Flex prompt template
questions.answer: Flex prompt template
questions.explanation: Product recommendations require custom logic and potentially multiple data inputs (Product Catalog, Opportunity details). A Flex template provides the open canvas needed to construct this complex prompt.

questions.question: The sales team at a hotel resort would like to generate a guest summary about the guests’ interests and provide recommendations based on their activity preferences captured in each guest profile. They want the summary to be available only on the contact record page. Which AI capability should the team use?
options: Model Builder
Agent Builder
Prompt Builder
questions.answer: Prompt Builder
questions.explanation: Prompt Builder allows you to create a 'Field Generation' template that can summarize the Contact's data and be placed directly on the Record Page (Lightning Page).

questions.question: Universal Containers built a Field Generation prompt template that worked for many records, but users are reporting random failures with token limit errors. What is the cause of the random nature of this error?
options: The template type needs to be switched to Flex to accommodate the variable amount of tokens generated by the prompt grounding.
The number of tokens generated by the dynamic nature of the prompt template will vary by record.
The number of tokens that can be processed by the LLM varies with total user demand.
questions.answer: The number of tokens generated by the dynamic nature of the prompt template will vary by record.
questions.explanation: Prompt templates are grounded in record data. If a specific record has an unusually large amount of text in the fields being merged, it can exceed the LLM's context window (token limit), causing the error only for that specific record.

questions.question: What is the primary function of the planner service in the Agent system?
options: Generating record queries based on conversation history
Offering real-time language translation during conversations
Identifying copilot actions to respond to user utterances
questions.answer: Identifying copilot actions to respond to user utterances
