questions.question: Universal Containers plans to enhance its sales team’s productivity using AI. Which specific requirement necessitates the use of Prompt Builder?
options: Creating a draft newsletter for an upcoming tradeshow.
Predicting the likelihood of customers churning or discontinuing their relationship with the company.
Creating an estimated Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) with historical purchase data.
questions.answer: Creating a draft newsletter for an upcoming tradeshow.
questions.explanation: Prompt Builder excels at generating text outputs (e.g., newsletters) using Generative AI. UC can create a prompt template to draft personalized, context-rich newsletters based on sales data, boosting productivity.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to offer personalized service experiences and reduce agent handling time with Al-generated email responses, grounded in Knowledge base. Which AI capability should UC use?
options: Einstein Email Replies
Einstein Service Replies for Email
Einstein Generative Service Replies for Email
questions.answer: Einstein Service Replies for Email
questions.explanation: The best solution is Einstein Service Replies for Email. This capability leverages AI to automatically generate responses to service-related emails based on historical data and the Knowledge base, ensuring accuracy and relevance.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) is looking to enhance its operational efficiency. UC has recently adopted Salesforce and is considering implementing Agent to improve its processes. What is a key reason for implementing Agent?
options: Improving data entry and data cleansing
Allowing AI to perform tasks without user interaction
Streamlining workflows and automating repetitive tasks
questions.answer: Streamlining workflows and automating repetitive tasks
questions.explanation: The key reason for implementing Agent is its ability to streamline workflows and automate repetitive tasks. By leveraging AI, Agent can assist users in handling mundane, repetitive processes.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to use the Draft with Einstein feature in Sales Cloud to create a personalized introduction email. After creating a proposed draft email, which predefined adjustment should UC choose to revise the draft with a more casual tone?
options: Make Less Formal
Enhance Friendliness
Optimize for Clarity
questions.answer: Make Less Formal
questions.explanation: The predefined adjustment to 'Make Less Formal' is the correct option to revise the draft with a more casual tone. This option adjusts the wording of the draft to sound less formal while maintaining professionalism.

questions.question: Universal Containers’ current AI data masking rules do not align with organizational privacy and security policies and requirements. What should An Agentforce recommend to resolve the issue?
options: Enable data masking for sandbox refreshes.
Configure data masking in the Einstein Trust Layer setup.
Add new data masking rules in LLM setup.
questions.answer: Configure data masking in the Einstein Trust Layer setup.
questions.explanation: The Agentforce Specialist should configure the data masking rules within the Einstein Trust Layer. The Einstein Trust Layer provides a secure and compliant environment where sensitive data can be masked or anonymized.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of Prompt Builder?
options: A tool for developers to use in Visual Studio Code that creates prompts for Apex programming, assisting developers in writing code more efficiently.
A tool that enables companies to create reusable prompts for large language models (LLMs), bringing generative AI responses to their flow of work
A tool within Salesforce offering real-time Al-powered suggestions and guidance to users, Improving productivity and decision-making.
questions.answer: A tool that enables companies to create reusable prompts for large language models (LLMs), bringing generative AI responses to their flow of work
questions.explanation: Prompt Builder is designed to help organizations create and configure reusable prompts for large language models (LLMs). By integrating generative AI responses into workflows, Prompt Builder enables customization of AI prompts.

questions.question: Universal Containers has an active standard email prompt template that does not fully deliver on the business requirements. Which steps should an Agentforce Specialist take to use the content of the standard prompt email template in question and customize it to fully meet the business requirements?
options: Save as New Template and edit as needed.
Clone the existing template and modify as needed.
Save as New Version and edit as needed.
questions.answer: Clone the existing template and modify as needed.
questions.explanation: Cloning creates a custom copy of the standard template, preserving its original content and structure while allowing modifications. This is the recommended approach for customizing standard templates.

questions.question: An Agentforce implements Einstein Sales Emails for a sales team. The team wants to send personalized follow-up emails to leads based on their interactions and data stored in Salesforce. The Agentforce Specialist needs to configure the system to use the most accurate and up-to-date information for email generation. Which grounding technique should the Agentforce Specialist use?
options: Ground with Apex Merge Fields
Ground with Record Merge Fields
Automatic grounding using Draft with Einstein feature
questions.answer: Ground with Record Merge Fields
questions.explanation: The most appropriate technique is Ground with Record Merge Fields. This method ensures that the content in the emails pulls dynamic and accurate data directly from Salesforce records, such as lead or contact information.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to enable its sales team to use AI to suggest recommended products from its catalog. Which type of prompt template should UC use?
options: Record summary prompt template
Email generation prompt template
Flex prompt template
questions.answer: Flex prompt template
questions.explanation: Flex prompt templates are versatile, allowing custom inputs (e.g., catalog data from objects or Data Cloud) and instructions. This flexibility suits UC’s need to recommend products dynamically.

questions.question: Amid their busy schedules, sales reps at Universal Containers dedicate time to follow up with prospects and existing clients via email regarding renewals or new deals. They spend many hours throughout the week reviewing past communications and details about their customers before performing their outreach. Which standard Agent action helps sales reps draft personalized emails to prospects by generating text based on previous successful communications?
options: Agent Action: Summarize Record
Agent Action: Find Similar Opportunities
Agent Action: Draft or Revise Sales Email
questions.answer: Agent Action: Draft or Revise Sales Email
questions.explanation: The 'Draft or Revise Sales Email' action in Agentforce for Sales uses the Atlas Reasoning Engine to generate personalized email content based on past successful communications.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) is creating a new custom prompt template to populate a field with generated output. UC enabled the Einstein Trust Layer to ensure AI Audit data is captured and monitored for adoption and possible enhancements. Which prompt template type should UC use and which consideration should UC review?
options: Field Generation, and that Dynamic Fields is enabled
Field Generation, and that Dynamic Forms is enabled
Flex, and that Dynamic Fields is enabled
questions.answer: Field Generation, and that Dynamic Fields is enabled
questions.explanation: UC needs a custom prompt template to populate a field, which aligns with the Field Generation prompt template type. The consideration UC should review is whether Dynamic Fields is enabled to incorporate variable data from Salesforce records.

questions.question: What is automatically created when a custom search index is created in Data Cloud?
options: A retriever that shares the name of the custom search index.
A dynamic retriever to allow runtime selection of retriever parameters without manual configuration.
A predefined Apex retriever class that can be edited by a developer to meet specific needs.
questions.answer: A retriever that shares the name of the custom search index.
questions.explanation: When a custom search index is created in Data Cloud, a corresponding retriever is automatically generated with the same name as the index.

questions.question: Universal Containers would like to route SMS text messages to a service rep from an Agentforce Service Agent. Which Service Channel should the company use in the flow to ensure it’s routed properly?
options: Messaging
Route Work Action
Live Agent
questions.answer: Messaging
questions.explanation: The 'Messaging' Service Channel handles text-based interactions, including SMS. When integrated with Omni-Channel Flow, the 'Route Work' action uses this channel to route SMS messages.

questions.question: What is the role of the large language model (LLM) in understanding intent and executing an Agent Action?
options: Find similar requested topics and provide the actions that need to be executed.
Identify the best matching topic and actions and correct order of execution.
Determine a user’s topic access and sort actions by priority to be executed.
questions.answer: Identify the best matching topic and actions and correct order of execution.
questions.explanation: The LLM analyzes user input to understand intent, matches it to the best-fitting topic, and selects associated actions. It also determines the correct sequence of execution based on the agent’s plan.

questions.question: In a Knowledge-based data library configuration, what is the primary difference between the identifying fields and the content fields?
options: Identifying fields help locate the correct Knowledge article, while content fields enrich AI responses with detailed information.
Identifying fields categorize articles for indexing purposes, while content fields provide a brief summary for display.
Identifying fields highlight key terms for relevance scoring, while content fields store the full text of the article for retrieval.
questions.answer: Identifying fields help locate the correct Knowledge article, while content fields enrich AI responses with detailed information.
questions.explanation: Identifying fields are used to search and pinpoint the relevant Knowledge article based on user input or context. Content fields provide the substantive data that the AI uses to generate detailed, enriched responses.

questions.question: How does the AI Retriever function within Data Cloud?
options: It performs contextual searches over an indexed repository to quickly fetch the most relevant documents, enabling grounding AI responses with trustworthy, verifiable information.
It monitors and aggregates data quality metrics across various data pipelines to ensure only high-integrity data is used for strategic decision-making.
It automatically extracts and reformats raw data from diverse sources into standardized datasets for use in historical trend analysis and forecasting.
questions.answer: It performs contextual searches over an indexed repository to quickly fetch the most relevant documents, enabling grounding AI responses with trustworthy, verifiable information.
questions.explanation: The AI Retriever in Data Cloud uses vector-based search technology to query an indexed repository and retrieve the most relevant results based on context.

questions.question: An Agentforce Specialist is creating a custom action in Agentforce. Which option is available for the Agentforce Specialist to choose for the custom Agent action?
options: Apex Trigger
SOQL
Flows
questions.answer: Flows
questions.explanation: In Agentforce Studio’s Agent Builder, custom actions can be created using Salesforce Flows. Flows allow complex logic and are explicitly supported as a custom action type.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) plans to implement prompt templates that utilize the standard foundation models. What should UC consider when building prompt templates in Prompt Builder?
options: Include multiple-choice questions within the prompt to test the LLM’s understanding of the context.
Ask it to role-play as a character in the prompt template to provide more context to the LL
Train LLM with data using different writing styles including word choice, intensifiers, emojis, and punctuation.
questions.answer: Ask it to role-play as a character in the prompt template to provide more context to the LL
questions.explanation: Instructing the LLM to adopt a role (e.g., 'Act as a sales expert') enhances context and tailors responses to UC’s needs, especially with standard models. This is a documented best practice.

questions.question: What considerations should an Agentforce Specialist be aware of when using Record Snapshots grounding in a prompt template?
options: Activities such as tasks and events are excluded.
Empty data, such as fields without values or sections without limits, is filtered out.
Email addresses associated with the object are excluded.
questions.answer: Activities such as tasks and events are excluded.
questions.explanation: According to Salesforce Agentforce documentation, when grounding a prompt template with Record Snapshots, activities (tasks and events) are not included in the snapshot because they are stored in a separate Activity object hierarchy.

questions.question: An administrator wants to check the response of the Flex prompt template they've built, but the preview button is greyed out. What is the reason for this?
options: The records related to the prompt have not been selected.
The prompt has not been saved and activated,
A merge field has not been inserted in the prompt.
questions.answer: The records related to the prompt have not been selected.
questions.explanation: Flex prompt templates pull data dynamically from Salesforce records. If there are no records specified for the prompt, it can't be previewed since there is no content to generate based on the template.

questions.question: Universal Containers needs its sales reps to be able to only execute prompt templates. What should the company use to achieve this requirement?
options: Prompt Execute Template permission set
Prompt Template User permission set
Prompt Template Manager permission set
questions.answer: Prompt Template User permission set
questions.explanation: The 'Prompt Template User' permission set grants users the ability to execute (or invoke) prompt templates without giving them the ability to create or modify them.

questions.question: An Agentforce configured Data Masking within the Einstein Trust Layer. How should the Agentforce Specialist begin validating that the correct fields are being masked?
options: Use a Flow-based resource in Prompt Builder to debug the fields’ merge values using Flow Debugger.
Request the Einstein Generative AI Audit Data from the Security section of the Setup menu.
Enable the collection and storage of Einstein Generative AI Audit Data on the Einstein Feedback setup page.
questions.answer: Enable the collection and storage of Einstein Generative AI Audit Data on the Einstein Feedback setup page.
questions.explanation: To validate data masking, the Specialist should enable audit data collection. This allows seeing how data is processed, including which fields are masked.

questions.question: What should An Agentforce consider when using related list merge fields in a prompt template associated with an Account object in Prompt Builder?
options: The Activities related list on the Account object is not supported because it is a polymorphic field.
If person accounts have been enabled, merge fields will not be available for the Account object.
Prompt generation will yield no response when there is no related list associated with an Account in runtime.
questions.answer: The Activities related list on the Account object is not supported because it is a polymorphic field.
questions.explanation: When using related list merge fields in a prompt template associated with the Account object, the Activities related list is not supported due to it being a polymorphic field.

questions.question: An Agentforce Specialist is tasked with analyzing Agent interactions, looking into user inputs, requests, and queries to identify patterns and trends. What functionality allows the Agentforce Specialist to achieve this?
options: Agent Event Logs dashboard.
AI Audit and Feedback Data dashboard.
User Utterances dashboard.
questions.answer: User Utterances dashboard.
questions.explanation: The User Utterances dashboard in Agentforce Analytics is specifically designed to analyze user inputs, requests, and queries, identifying patterns and trends.

questions.question: An administrator is responsible for ensuring the security and reliability of Universal Containers' (UC) CRM data. UC needs enhanced data protection and up-to-date AI capabilities. UC also needs to include relevant information from a Salesforce record to be merged with the prompt. Which feature in the Einstein Trust Layer best supports UC's need?
options: Data masking
Dynamic grounding with secure data retrieval
Zero-data retention policy
questions.answer: Dynamic grounding with secure data retrieval
questions.explanation: Dynamic grounding with secure data retrieval allows relevant Salesforce data to be merged into the AI-generated responses while ensuring data protection.

questions.question: Which scenario best demonstrates when an Agentforce Data Library is most useful for improving an AI agent’s response accuracy?
options: When the AI agent must provide answers based on a curated set of policy documents that are stored, regularly updated, and indexed in the data library.
When the AI agent needs to combine data from disparate sources based on mutually common data, such as Customer Id and Product Id for grounding.
When data is being retrieved from Snowflake using zero-copy for vectorization and retrieval.
questions.answer: When the AI agent must provide answers based on a curated set of policy documents that are stored, regularly updated, and indexed in the data library.
questions.explanation: The Data Library is designed to store and index structured content (e.g., Knowledge articles, policy documents) for semantic search and grounding.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) has a legacy system that needs to integrate with Salesforce. UC wishes to create a digest of account action plans using the generative API feature. Which API service should UC use to meet this requirement?
options: REST API
Metadata API
SOAP API
questions.answer: REST API
questions.explanation: To create a digest of account action plans using the generative API feature, Universal Containers should use the REST API, which is ideal for integrating Salesforce with external systems and enabling interaction with Salesforce data.

questions.question: An Agentforce at Universal Containers is working on a prompt template to generate personalized emails for product demonstration requests from customers. It is important for the Al-generated email to adhere strictly to the guidelines, using only associated opportunity information, and to encourage the recipient to take the desired action. How should the Agentforce Specialist include these instructions on a new line in the prompt template?
options: Surround them with triple quotes ("").
Make sure merged fields are defined.
Use curly brackets {} to encapsulate instructions.
questions.answer: Surround them with triple quotes ("").
questions.explanation: In Salesforce prompt templates, instructions that guide how the Large Language Model (LLM) should generate content can be included by surrounding the instruction text with triple quotes.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to limit an agent’s access to Knowledge articles while deploying the 'Answer Questions with Knowledge' action. How should UC achieve this?
options: Define scope instructions to the agent specifying a list of allowed article titles or IDs.
Update the Data Library Retriever to filter on a custom field on the Knowledge article.
Assign Data Categories to Knowledge articles, and define Data Category filters in the Agentforce Data Library.
questions.answer: Assign Data Categories to Knowledge articles, and define Data Category filters in the Agentforce Data Library.
questions.explanation: Using Data Categories and filters in the Data Library is the recommended, scalable way to limit Knowledge article access for agent actions.

questions.question: In Model Playground, which hyperparameters of an existing Salesforce-enabled foundational model can An Agentforce change?
options: Temperature, Frequency Penalty, Presence Penalty
Temperature, Top-k sampling, Presence Penalty
Temperature, Frequency Penalty, Output Tokens
questions.answer: Temperature, Frequency Penalty, Presence Penalty
questions.explanation: In Model Playground, the key tunable hyperparameters are Temperature (randomness), Frequency Penalty (reduces repetition), and Presence Penalty (encourages new topics).

questions.question: An Agentforce is creating a custom action in Agent. Which option is available for the Agentforce Specialist to choose for the custom copilot action?
options: Apex trigger
SOQL
Flows
questions.answer: Flows
questions.explanation: Flows are the recommended method for creating custom actions within Agent because they are declarative and highly adaptable.

questions.question: What is An Agentforce able to do when the “Enrich event logs with conversation data" setting in Agent is enabled?
options: View the user click path that led to each copilot action.
View session data including user Input and copilot responses for sessions over the past 7 days.
Generate details reports on all Copilot conversations over any time period.
questions.answer: View session data including user Input and copilot responses for sessions over the past 7 days.
questions.explanation: This setting enriches the event logs with detailed conversational data for better insights into the interaction history.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to enable its sales team to get insights into product and competitor names mentioned during calls. How should UC meet this requirement?
options: Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, connect a recording provider, assign permission sets, and customize insights with up to 25 products.
Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, assign permission sets, define recording managers, and customize insights with up to 50 competitor names.
Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, enable sales recording, assign permission sets, and customize insights with up to 50 products.
questions.answer: Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, connect a recording provider, assign permission sets, and customize insights with up to 25 products.
questions.explanation: Salesforce documentation confirms the 25-item limit for custom keywords and requires connecting an external recording provider.

questions.question: What is a valid use case for Data Cloud retrievers?
options: Returning relevant data from the vector database to augment a prompt.
Grounding data from external websites to augment a prompt with RA
Modifying and updating data within the source systems connected to Data Cloud.
questions.answer: Returning relevant data from the vector database to augment a prompt.
questions.explanation: Data Cloud retrievers are specialized components that fetch relevant data from Data Cloud’s vector database to enhance agent responses or actions.

questions.question: An Agentforce wants to use the related lists from an account in a custom prompt template. What should the Agentforce Specialist consider when configuring the prompt template?
options: The text encoding (for example, UTF-8, ASCII) option
The maximum number of related list merge fields
The choice between XML and JSON rendering formats for the list
questions.answer: The maximum number of related list merge fields
questions.explanation: Salesforce enforces limits on how many related list merge fields can be included in a prompt template to ensure performance.

questions.question: Universal Containers’ data science team is hosting a generative large language model (LLM) on Amazon Web Services (AWS). What should the team use to access externally-hosted models in the Salesforce Platform?
options: Model Builder
App Builder
Copilot Builder
questions.answer: Model Builder
questions.explanation: Model Builder in Salesforce allows teams to integrate and deploy external AI models into the Salesforce platform.

questions.question: A data scientist needs to view and manage models in Einstein Studio, and also needs to create prompt templates in Prompt Builder. Which permission sets should an Agentforce Specialist assign to the data scientist?
options: Prompt Template Manager and Prompt Template User
Data Cloud Admin and Prompt Template Manager
Prompt Template User and Data Cloud Admin
questions.answer: Data Cloud Admin and Prompt Template Manager
questions.explanation: 'Data Cloud Admin' covers model management in Data Cloud, and 'Prompt Template Manager' covers admin-level Prompt Builder access.

questions.question: Universal Containers wants to leverage the Record Snapshots grounding feature in a prompt template. What preparations are required?
options: Configure page layout of the master record type.
Create a field set for all the fields to be grounded.
Enable and configure dynamic form for the object.
questions.answer: Configure page layout of the master record type.
questions.explanation: Record Snapshots in Salesforce Prompt Builder leverage the data visible on the user's page layout for an object to ground the prompt.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) currently tracks Leads with a custom object. UC is preparing to implement the Sales Development Representative (SDR) Agent. Which consideration should UC keep in mind?
options: Agentforce SDR only works with the standard Lead object.
Agentforce SDR only works on Opportunities.
Agentforce SDR only supports custom objects associated with Accounts.
questions.answer: Agentforce SDR only works with the standard Lead object.
questions.explanation: The Agentforce SDR Agent is specifically designed to interact with the standard Lead object in Salesforce and does not natively extend to custom objects.

questions.question: What should Universal Containers consider when deploying an Agentforce Service Agent with multiple topics and Agent Actions to production?
options: Deploy agent components without a test run in staging, relying on production data for reliable results. Sandbox configuration alone ensures seamless production deployment.
Ensure all dependencies are included, Apex classes meet 75% test coverage, and configuration settings are aligned with production. Plan for version management and post-deployment activation.
Deploy flows or Apex after agents, topics, and Agent Actions to avoid deployment failures and potential production agent issues requiring complete redeployment.
questions.answer: Ensure all dependencies are included, Apex classes meet 75% test coverage, and configuration settings are aligned with production. Plan for version management and post-deployment activation.
questions.explanation: This is a comprehensive approach: dependencies (e.g., flows, Apex) must be deployed, Apex requires 75% coverage, and production settings must align. Version management tracks changes, and post-deployment activation ensures controlled rollout.

questions.question: Universal Containers needs its sales reps to be able to only execute prompt templates. What should the company use to achieve this requirement?
options: Prompt Execute Template permission set
Prompt Template User permission set
Prompt Template Manager permission set
questions.answer: Prompt Template User permission set
questions.explanation: The 'Prompt Template User' permission set grants users the ability to execute (or invoke) prompt templates without giving them the ability to create or modify them. This aligns perfectly with the requirement that sales reps should only execute prompt templates, not manage them.

questions.question: Universal Containers has an active standard email prompt template that does not fully deliver on the business requirements. Which steps should an Agentforce Specialist take to use the content of the standard prompt email template in question and customize it to fully meet the business requirements?
options: Save as New Template and edit as needed.
Clone the existing template and modify as needed.
Save as New Version and edit as needed.
questions.answer: Clone the existing template and modify as needed.
questions.explanation: Cloning creates a custom copy of the standard template, preserving its original content and structure while allowing modifications. This is the recommended approach for customizing standard templates.

questions.question: Where should the Agentforce Specialist go to add/update actions assigned to a copilot?
options: Copilot Actions page, the record page for the copilot action, or the Copilot Action Library tab
Copilot Actions page or Global Actions
Copilot Detail page, Global Actions, or the record page for the copilot action
questions.answer: Copilot Actions page, the record page for the copilot action, or the Copilot Action Library tab
questions.explanation: Agentforce can manage this through several areas: Copilot Actions Page, Record Page for the Copilot Action, or Copilot Action Library Tab.

questions.question: When configuring a prompt template, an Agentforce Specialist previews the results of the prompt template they've written. They see two distinct text outputs: Resolution and Response. Which information does the Resolution text provide?
options: It shows the full text that is sent to the Trust Layer.
It shows the response from the LLM based on the sample record.
It shows which sensitive data is masked before it is sent to the LLM
questions.answer: It shows the full text that is sent to the Trust Layer.
questions.explanation: Resolution text specifically refers to the full text that is sent to the Trust Layer for processing, monitoring, and governance. This includes the constructed prompt as it’s submitted to the large language model (LLM).

questions.question: What is true of Agentforce Testing Center?
options: Running tests risks modifying CRM data in a production environment.
Running tests does not consume Einstein Requests.
Agentforce Testing Center can only be used in a production environment.
questions.answer: Running tests does not consume Einstein Requests.
questions.explanation: Einstein Requests are part of the usage quota for Einstein Generative AI features. Testing Center uses synthetic data to simulate interactions without invoking live AI calls that count against this quota.

questions.question: Universal Containers has implemented an agent that answers questions based on Knowledge articles. Which topic and Agent Action will be shown in the Agent Builder?
options: General Q&A topic and Knowledge Article Answers action.
General CRM topic and Answers Questions with LLM Action.
General FAQ topic and Answers Questions with Knowledge Action.
questions.answer: General FAQ topic and Answers Questions with Knowledge Action.
questions.explanation: In Agent Builder, the 'General FAQ' topic is a common default or starting point for question-answering agents. The 'Answers Questions with Knowledge' action is a prebuilt action that retrieves and grounds responses with Knowledge articles.

questions.question: An Agentforce wants to ground a new prompt template with the User related list. What should the Agentforce Specialist consider?
options: The User related list should have View All access.
The User related list needs to be included on the record page.
The User related list is not supported in prompt templates.
questions.answer: The User related list is not supported in prompt templates.
questions.explanation: Salesforce restricts grounding prompt templates with the User related list due to security and privacy concerns regarding user data.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to assess Salesforce's generative features but has concerns over its company data being exposed to third-party large language models (LLMs). Which property of the Einstein Trust Layer should the Agentforce Specialist highlight to UC that addresses these requirements?
options: Prompt Defense
Zero-Data Retention Policy
Data Masking
questions.answer: Zero-Data Retention Policy
questions.explanation: The Zero-Data Retention Policy ensures that no data is used for training or product improvements by third-party LLMs and no data is retained outside of the customer's Salesforce organization.

questions.question: An Agentforce wants to include data from the response of external service invocation (REST API callout) into the prompt template. How should the Agentforce Specialist meet this requirement?
options: Convert the JSON to an XML merge field.
Use External Service Record merge fields.
Use 'Add Prompt Instructions' flow element.
questions.answer: Use External Service Record merge fields.
questions.explanation: External Service Record merge fields allow prompt templates to access and use data returned from REST API callouts directly.

questions.question: For an Agentforce Data Library that contains uploaded files, what occurs once it is created and configured?
options: Indexes the uploaded files in a location specified by the user
Indexes the uploaded files into Data Cloud
Indexes the uploaded files in Salesforce File Storage
questions.answer: Indexes the uploaded files into Data Cloud
questions.explanation: When a Data Library is set up, the files are ingested and indexed into Data Cloud’s vector database.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to limit an agent’s access to Knowledge articles while deploying the 'Answer Questions with Knowledge' action. How should UC achieve this?
options: Define scope instructions to the agent specifying a list of allowed article titles or IDs.
Update the Data Library Retriever to filter on a custom field on the Knowledge article.
Assign Data Categories to Knowledge articles, and define Data Category filters in the Agentforce Data Library.
questions.answer: Assign Data Categories to Knowledge articles, and define Data Category filters in the Agentforce Data Library.
questions.explanation: Using Data Categories and filters in the Data Library is the recommended way to limit Knowledge article access for agent actions.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to create a new Sales Email prompt template in Prompt Builder using the 'Save As' function. However, UC notices that the new template produces different results compared to the standard Sales Email prompt due to missing hyperparameters. What should UC do to ensure the new prompt template produces results comparable to the standard Sales Email prompts?
options: Use Model Playground to create a model configuration with the specified parameters.
Manually add the hyperparameters to the new template.
Revert to using the standard template without modifications.
questions.answer: Manually add the hyperparameters to the new template.
questions.explanation: Hyperparameters like Temperature, Frequency Penalty, and Presence Penalty affect AI responses. Ensuring these are consistent with the standard template is necessary when cloning/saving as new.

questions.question: Universal Containers is evaluating Einstein Generative AI features to improve the productivity of the service center operation. Which features should the Agentforce Specialist recommend?
options: Service Replies and Case Summaries
Service Replies and Work Summaries
Reply Recommendations and Sales Summaries
questions.answer: Service Replies and Case Summaries
questions.explanation: Service Replies automate response generation, and Case Summaries provide quick overviews, both enhancing service center productivity.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) has configured an Agentforce Data Library using Knowledge articles. When testing in Agent Builder and the Experience Cloud site, the agent is not responding with grounded Knowledge article information. However, when tested in Prompt Builder, the response returns correctly. What should UC do to troubleshoot the issue?
options: Create a new permission set that assigns 'Manage Knowledge' and assign it to the Agentforce Service Agent User.
Ensure the assigned User permission set includes access to the prompt template used to access the Knowledge articles.
Ensure the Data Cloud User permission set has been assigned to the Agentforce Service Agent User.
questions.answer: Ensure the Data Cloud User permission set has been assigned to the Agentforce Service Agent User.
questions.explanation: The Agentforce Service Agent User needs the 'Data Cloud User' permission set to access Data Cloud resources, including the Data Library.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to offer personalized service experiences and reduce agent handling time with AI-generated email responses, grounded in Knowledge base. Which AI capability should UC use?
options: Einstein Email Replies
Einstein Service Replies for Email
Einstein Generative Service Replies for Email
questions.answer: Einstein Service Replies for Email
questions.explanation: Einstein Service Replies for Email leverages AI to automatically generate responses to service-related emails based on historical data and the Knowledge base.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) is experimenting with using public Generative AI models. However, it can be time-consuming for reps to type in the prompt and ensure consistency. Which Salesforce feature should the company use to address these concerns?
options: Agent Builder and Action: Query Records.
Einstein Prompt Builder and Prompt Templates.
Einstein Recommendation Builder.
questions.answer: Einstein Prompt Builder and Prompt Templates.
questions.explanation: Einstein Prompt Builder allows users to create reusable prompt templates that encapsulate instructions and grounding, saving time and ensuring consistency.

questions.question: A support team handles a high volume of chat interactions and needs a solution to provide quick, relevant responses to customer inquiries. Responses must be grounded in the organization's knowledge base. Which feature in Einstein for Service should the support team use?
options: Einstein Service Replies
Einstein Reply Recommendations
Einstein Knowledge Recommendations
questions.answer: Einstein Service Replies
questions.explanation: Einstein Service Replies generates contextual, AI-powered response suggestions grounded in the organization's knowledge base.

questions.question: What is the correct process to leverage Prompt Builder in a Salesforce org?
options: Select the appropriate prompt template type to use, select one of Salesforce's standard prompts, determine the object to associate the prompt, select a record to validate against, and associate the prompt to an action.

Select the appropriate prompt template type to use, develop the prompt within the prompt workspace, select resources to dynamically insert CRM-derived grounding data, pick the model to use, and test and validate the generated responses.

Enable the target object for generative prompting, develop the prompt within the prompt workspace, select records to fine-tune and ground the response, enable the Trust Layer, and associate the prompt to an action.
questions.answer: Select the appropriate prompt template type to use, develop the prompt within the prompt workspace, select resources to dynamically insert CRM-derived grounding data, pick the model to use, and test and validate the generated responses.
questions.explanation: The correct process involves selecting the template type, developing the prompt, adding grounding data, picking the model, and testing.

questions.question: Which standard Agent action helps sales reps draft personalized emails to prospects by generating text based on previous successful communications?
options: Agent Action: Summarize Record
Agent Action: Find Similar Opportunities
Agent Action: Draft or Revise Sales Email
questions.answer: Agent Action: Draft or Revise Sales Email
questions.explanation: The 'Draft or Revise Sales Email' action uses the Atlas Reasoning Engine to generate personalized email content, potentially using past communications.

questions.question: Universal Containers implements Custom Agent Actions. What should the development team review in the Custom Agent Action configuration to identify one of the core components of a Custom Agent Action?
options: Action Triggers
Instructions
Output Types
questions.answer: Instructions
questions.explanation: Instructions are a core component of a Custom Agent Action, guiding the Atlas Reasoning Engine on how to execute the action.

questions.question: Universal Containers has seen a high adoption rate of a new feature that uses generative AI to populate a summary field. One user cannot see the generative AI-enabled field icon. What is the most likely cause of the issue?
options: The user does not have the Prompt Template User permission set assigned.
The prompt template associated with summary field is not activated for that user.
The user does not have the field Generative AI User permission set assigned.
questions.answer: The user does not have the field Generative AI User permission set assigned.
questions.explanation: The Generative AI User permission set is required to enable generative AI capabilities for a user, including the visibility of AI-enabled field icons.

questions.question: What is the role of the large language model (LLM) in understanding intent and executing an Agent Action?
options: Find similar requested topics and provide the actions that need to be executed.
Identify the best matching topic and actions and correct order of execution.
Determine a user’s topic access and sort actions by priority to be executed.
questions.answer: Identify the best matching topic and actions and correct order of execution.
questions.explanation: The LLM analyzes user input, matches it to the best-fitting topic, selects associated actions, and determines the execution sequence.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) is concerned that there are many legacy fields with data that might not be applicable for Einstein AI to draft accurate email responses. Which solution should UC use to ensure Einstein AI can draft responses from a defined data source?
options: Service AI Grounding
Work Summaries
Service Replies
questions.answer: Service AI Grounding
questions.explanation: Service AI Grounding ensures Einstein AI drafts responses based on specific, relevant data sources like Knowledge articles or cases, avoiding legacy fields.

questions.question: Universal Containers tests out a new Einstein Generative AI feature. Sometimes, users find that the draft email contains placeholders for attributes that could have been derived from the recipient’s contact record. What is the most likely explanation for why the draft email shows these placeholders?
options: The user does not have permission to access the fields.
The user’s locale language is not supported by Prompt Builder.
The user does not have Einstein Sales Emails permission assigned.
questions.answer: The user does not have permission to access the fields.
questions.explanation: If the user lacks permission to access relevant fields, the system cannot retrieve the data, leaving placeholders unresolved.

questions.question: Universal Containers wants to implement a solution in Salesforce with a custom UX that allows users to enter a sales order number, then invokes a custom prompt template to create a summary. Which solution should an Agentforce Specialist implement?
options: Create an autolaunched flow and invoke the prompt template using the standard 'Prompt Template' flow action.
Create a template-triggered prompt flow and invoke the prompt template using the standard 'Prompt Template' flow action.
Create a screen flow to collect the sales order number and invoke the prompt template using the standard 'Prompt Template' flow action.
questions.answer: Create a screen flow to collect the sales order number and invoke the prompt template using the standard 'Prompt Template' flow action.
questions.explanation: A screen flow provides the custom user interface to collect input, which can then be passed to the prompt template via the flow action.

questions.question: An AI Specialist is tasked with configuring a generative model to create personalized sales emails. Security and data privacy are critical concerns. How should the Agentforce Specialist integrate the custom LLM into Salesforce?
options: Create an application of the custom LLM and embed it in Sales Cloud via iFrame.
Add the fine-tuned LLM in Einstein Studio Model Builder.
Enable model endpoint on OpenAI and make callouts to the model to generate emails.
questions.answer: Add the fine-tuned LLM in Einstein Studio Model Builder.
questions.explanation: Einstein Studio allows secure integration and management of custom AI models (BYOM) within Salesforce.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to implement an AI-powered customer service agent that can retrieve proprietary policy documents stored as PDFs. What should UC do first?
options: Set up an Agentforce Data Library for AI retrieval of policy documents.
Expand the AI agent's scope to search all Salesforce records.
Add the files to the content, and then select the data library option.
questions.answer: Set up an Agentforce Data Library for AI retrieval of policy documents.
questions.explanation: Creating a Data Library allows uploading and indexing PDFs into Data Cloud, enabling the AI to retrieve and ground responses in this content.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to make a sales proposal and directly use data from multiple unrelated objects (standard and custom) in a prompt template. How should UC accomplish this?
options: Create a prompt template passing in a special custom object that connects the records temporarily.
Create a prompt template-triggered flow to access the data from standard and custom objects.
Create a Flex template to add resources with standard and custom objects as inputs.
questions.answer: Create a Flex template to add resources with standard and custom objects as inputs.
questions.explanation: Flex templates allow defining dynamic inputs from multiple unrelated Salesforce objects.

questions.question: A data scientist needs to view and manage models in Einstein Studio, and also needs to create prompt templates in Prompt Builder. Which permission sets should an Agentforce Specialist assign to the data scientist?
options: Prompt Template Manager and Prompt Template User
Data Cloud Admin and Prompt Template Manager
Prompt Template User and Data Cloud Admin
questions.answer: Data Cloud Admin and Prompt Template Manager
questions.explanation: 'Data Cloud Admin' covers model management in Data Cloud/Einstein Studio, and 'Prompt Template Manager' covers admin-level Prompt Builder access.

questions.question: Universal Containers’ current AI data masking rules do not align with organizational privacy and security policies. What should An Agentforce recommend?
options: Enable data masking for sandbox refreshes.
Configure data masking in the Einstein Trust Layer setup.
Add new data masking rules in LLM setup.
questions.answer: Configure data masking in the Einstein Trust Layer setup.
questions.explanation: The Einstein Trust Layer allows configuration of data masking rules to ensure compliance with privacy policies.

questions.question: Which scenario best demonstrates when an Agentforce Data Library is most useful for improving an AI agent’s response accuracy?
options: When the AI agent must provide answers based on a curated set of policy documents that are stored, regularly updated, and indexed in the data library.
When the AI agent needs to combine data from disparate sources based on mutually common data, such as Customer Id and Product Id for grounding.
When data is being retrieved from Snowflake using zero-copy for vectorization and retrieval.
questions.answer: When the AI agent must provide answers based on a curated set of policy documents that are stored, regularly updated, and indexed in the data library.
questions.explanation: The Data Library excels at storing and indexing structured content like policy documents for accurate grounding.

questions.question: An Agentforce Specialist cannot access Prompt Builder in the Setup menu even though Einstein Generative AI is enabled. What is causing the problem?
options: The Prompt Template User permission set was not assigned correctly.
The Prompt Template Manager permission set was not assigned correctly.
The large language model (LLM) was not configured correctly in Data Cloud.
questions.answer: The Prompt Template Manager permission set was not assigned correctly.
questions.explanation: The Prompt Template Manager permission set is required to access and create custom prompt templates in Prompt Builder.

questions.question: A customer service representative needs to cancel flights due to a weather alert and review Knowledge articles. Which Agentforce capability helps the representative accomplish this?
options: Invoke a flow which makes a call to external data to create a Knowledge article.
Execute tasks based on available actions, answering questions using information from accessible Knowledge articles.
Generate Knowledge article based off the prompts that the agent enters to create steps to cancel flights.
questions.answer: Execute tasks based on available actions, answering questions using information from accessible Knowledge articles.
questions.explanation: This capability allows the agent to perform actions (cancel flights) and retrieve information (Knowledge articles) simultaneously.

questions.question: An Agentforce Specialist is creating a custom action in Agentforce. Which option is available for the Agentforce Specialist to choose for the custom Agent action?
options: Apex Trigger
SOQL
Flows
questions.answer: Flows
questions.explanation: Flows are a supported custom action type in Agentforce Agent Builder.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to use the Draft with Einstein feature in Sales Cloud to create a personalized introduction email. Which predefined adjustment should UC choose to revise the draft with a more casual tone?
options: Make Less Formal
Enhance Friendliness
Optimize for Clarity
questions.answer: Make Less Formal
questions.explanation: The 'Make Less Formal' adjustment revises the draft to have a more casual tone.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to enable its sales team to get insights into product and competitor names mentioned during calls. How should UC meet this requirement?
options: Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, connect a recording provider, assign permission sets, and customize insights with up to 25 products.
Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, assign permission sets, define recording managers, and customize insights with up to 50 competitor names.
Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, enable sales recording, assign permission sets, and customize insights with up to 50 products.
questions.answer: Enable Einstein Conversation Insights, connect a recording provider, assign permission sets, and customize insights with up to 25 products.
questions.explanation: Setup involves enabling ECI, connecting a provider, and customizing insights, with a limit of 25 custom keywords.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) is Implementing Service AI Grounding. Which objects should UC select to configure Service AI Grounding?
options: Case, Knowledge, and Case Notes
Case and Knowledge
Case, Case Emails, and Knowledge
questions.answer: Case and Knowledge
questions.explanation: Supported objects for Service AI Grounding typically include Case and Knowledge.

questions.question: How does an Agent respond when it can’t understand the request or find any requested information?
options: With a preconfigured message, based on the action type.
With a general message asking the user to rephrase the request.
With a generated error message.
questions.answer: With a general message asking the user to rephrase the request.
questions.explanation: The default fallback behavior is a general message asking the user to rephrase.

questions.question: When creating a custom retriever in Einstein Studio, which step is considered essential?
options: Select the search index, specify the associated data model object (DMO) and data space, and optionally define filters to narrow search results.
Define the output configuration by specifying the maximum number of results to return, and map the output fields that will ground the prompt.
Configure the search index, choose vector or hybrid search, choose the fields for filtering, the data space and model, then define the ranking method.
questions.answer: Select the search index, specify the associated data model object (DMO) and data space, and optionally define filters to narrow search results.
questions.explanation: Selecting the search index, DMO, and data space provides the essential foundation for the retriever.

questions.question: Universal Containers would like to route SMS text messages to a service rep from an Agentforce Service Agent. Which Service Channel should the company use in the flow to ensure it’s routed properly?
options: Messaging
Route Work Action
Live Agent
questions.answer: Messaging
questions.explanation: The 'Messaging' Service Channel supports SMS routing in Omni-Channel Flow.

questions.question: Universal Containers recently launched a pilot program with Agentforce Agents. How should the Agentforce Specialist monitor Agents’ usability and the assignment of actions?
options: Run a report on the Platform Debug Logs.
Query the Agent log data using the Metadata API
Run Agent Analytics.
questions.answer: Run Agent Analytics.
questions.explanation: Agent Analytics provides dashboards and reports for monitoring agent performance, usability, and action assignments.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) would like to implement the Sales Development Representative (SDR) Agent. Which channel consideration should UC be aware of while implementing it?
options: SDR Agent must be deployed in the Messaging channel.
SDR Agent only works in the Email channel.
SDR Agent must also be deployed on the company website.
questions.answer: SDR Agent must be deployed in the Messaging channel.
questions.explanation: The SDR Agent is primarily designed for the Messaging channel to engage prospects in real-time.

questions.question: Universal Containers Is Interested In Improving the sales operation efficiency by analyzing their data using Al-powered predictions in Einstein Studio. Which use case works for this scenario?
options: Predict customer sentiment toward a promotion message.
Predict customer lifetime value of an account.
Predict most popular products from new product catalog.
questions.answer: Predict customer lifetime value of an account.
questions.explanation: Predicting customer lifetime value (CLV) is a standard use case for AI predictions to optimize sales strategies.

questions.question: Universal Containers wants to leverage the Record Snapshots grounding feature in a prompt template. What preparations are required?
options: Configure page layout of the master record type.
Create a field set for all the fields to be grounded.
Enable and configure dynamic form for the object.
questions.answer: Configure page layout of the master record type.
questions.explanation: Record Snapshots use the fields visible on the user's page layout for the object.

questions.question: Which use case is best supported by Salesforce Agent's capabilities?
options: Bring together a conversational interface for interacting with AI for all Salesforce users, such as developers and ecommerce retailers.
Enable Salesforce admin users to create and train custom large language models (LLMs) using CRM data.
Enable data scientists to train predictive AI models with historical CRM data using built-in machine learning capabilities
questions.answer: Bring together a conversational interface for interacting with AI for all Salesforce users, such as developers and ecommerce retailers.
questions.explanation: Salesforce Agent provides a conversational AI interface for various user types to interact with the system.

questions.question: Which feature in the Einstein Trust Layer best supports UC's need for enhanced data protection and merging relevant information from a Salesforce record into a prompt?
options: Data masking
Dynamic grounding with secure data retrieval
Zero-data retention policy
questions.answer: Dynamic grounding with secure data retrieval
questions.explanation: Dynamic grounding allows securely retrieving and merging Salesforce data into prompts.

questions.question: In a Knowledge-based data library configuration, what is the primary difference between the identifying fields and the content fields?
options: Identifying fields help locate the correct Knowledge article, while content fields enrich AI responses with detailed information.
Identifying fields categorize articles for indexing purposes, while content fields provide a brief summary for display.
Identifying fields highlight key terms for relevance scoring, while content fields store the full text of the article for retrieval.
questions.answer: Identifying fields help locate the correct Knowledge article, while content fields enrich AI responses with detailed information.
questions.explanation: Identifying fields target the correct article, while content fields provide the substance for the AI's response.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to build an Agentforce Service Agent that provides the latest policy information, ensures responses are grounded on published Knowledge, and allows immediate updates. What should UC do?
options: Enable the agent to search all internal records and past customer inquiries.
Set up an Agentforce Data Library to store and index policy documents for AI retrieval.
Manually add policy responses into the AI model to prevent hallucinations.
questions.answer: Set up an Agentforce Data Library to store and index policy documents for AI retrieval.
questions.explanation: An Agentforce Data Library integrating with Knowledge ensures semantic search, grounding, and instant updates.

questions.question: Which audit data is available using the Einstein Trust Layer?
options: Response accuracy and offensiveness score
Hallucination score and bias score
Masked data and toxicity score
questions.answer: Masked data and toxicity score
questions.explanation: The Einstein Trust Layer provides audit data including masked data logs and toxicity scores.

questions.question: Universal Containers wants to reduce overall customer support handling time by minimizing typing for routine answers and reducing post-chat analysis. Which combination of Agentforce for Service features enables this?
options: Einstein Reply Recommendations and Case Classification
Einstein Reply Recommendations and Case Summaries
Einstein Service Replies and Work Summaries
questions.answer: Einstein Reply Recommendations and Case Classification
questions.explanation: Reply Recommendations speed up responses, and Case Classification automates field population.

questions.question: What is automatically created when a custom search index is created in Data Cloud?
options: A retriever that shares the name of the custom search index.
A dynamic retriever to allow runtime selection of retriever parameters without manual configuration.
A predefined Apex retriever class that can be edited by a developer to meet specific needs.
questions.answer: A retriever that shares the name of the custom search index.
questions.explanation: Data Cloud automatically generates a retriever corresponding to the custom search index.

questions.question: Universal Containers’ data science team is hosting a generative large language model (LLM) on Amazon Web Services (AWS). What should the team use to access externally-hosted models in the Salesforce Platform?
options: Model Builder
App Builder
Copilot Builder
questions.answer: Model Builder
questions.explanation: Model Builder allows integration and deployment of external AI models (BYOM) into Salesforce.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) currently tracks Leads with a custom object. UC is preparing to implement the Sales Development Representative (SDR) Agent. Which consideration should UC keep in mind?
options: Agentforce SDR only works with the standard Lead object.
Agentforce SDR only works on Opportunities.
Agentforce SDR only supports custom objects associated with Accounts.
questions.answer: Agentforce SDR only works with the standard Lead object.
questions.explanation: The SDR Agent is pre-configured to work with the standard Lead object.

questions.question: A service agent needs to cancel flights and review Knowledge articles about the process. Which Agent capability helps the agent accomplish this?
options: Execute tasks based on available actions, answering questions using information from accessible Knowledge articles.
Invoke a flow which makes a call to external data to create a Knowledge article.
Generate a Knowledge article based off the prompts that the agent enters to create steps to cancel flights.
questions.answer: Execute tasks based on available actions, answering questions using information from accessible Knowledge articles.
questions.explanation: Agent can execute actions (cancel flight) and answer questions using Knowledge simultaneously.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) implements a custom retriever but notices it returns too many irrelevant results. What should UC do to ensure only relevant data is retrieved?
options: Define filters to narrow the search results based on specific conditions.
Change the search index to a different data model object (DMO).
Increase the maximum number of results returned to capture a broader dataset.
questions.answer: Define filters to narrow the search results based on specific conditions.
questions.explanation: Filters allow refining the search criteria to return only relevant data.

questions.question: Universal Containers has grounded a prompt template with a related list. During user acceptance testing (UAT), users are not getting the correct responses. What is causing this issue?
options: The related list is Read Only.
The related list prompt template option is not enabled.
The related list is not on the parent object’s page layout.
questions.answer: The related list is not on the parent object’s page layout.
questions.explanation: Related list data availability for grounding often depends on the related list being present on the parent object's page layout.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of Prompt Builder?
options: A tool for developers to use in Visual Studio Code that creates prompts for Apex programming, assisting developers in writing code more efficiently.
A tool that enables companies to create reusable prompts for large language models (LLMs), bringing generative AI responses to their flow of work
A tool within Salesforce offering real-time Al-powered suggestions and guidance to users, Improving productivity and decision-making.
questions.answer: A tool that enables companies to create reusable prompts for large language models (LLMs), bringing generative AI responses to their flow of work
questions.explanation: Prompt Builder enables creating and managing reusable prompts for generative AI.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) has a legacy system that needs to integrate with Salesforce. UC wishes to create a digest of account action plans using the generative API feature. Which API service should UC use?
options: REST API
Metadata API
SOAP API
questions.answer: REST API
questions.explanation: The REST API is suitable for data integration and interacting with generative capabilities.

questions.question: Universal Containers is using Agentforce for Sales to find similar opportunities. What is one criterion that Agentforce for Sales uses to match similar opportunities?
options: Matched opportunities have a status of Closed Won from the last 12 months.
Matched opportunities are limited to the same account.
Matched opportunities were created in the last 12 months.
questions.answer: Matched opportunities have a status of Closed Won from the last 12 months.
questions.explanation: Agentforce uses 'Closed Won' status and a 12-month lookback period as criteria for similarity matching.

questions.question: Universal Containers (UC) wants to ensure the effectiveness and reliability of its agents prior to deployment, efficiently testing a large number of utterances. What should the Agentforce Specialist recommend?
options: Leverage the Agent Large Language Model (LLM) UI and test UC's agents with different utterances prior to activating the agent.
Deploy the agent in a QA sandbox environment and review the Utterance Analysis reports to review effectiveness.
Create a CSV file with UC's test cases in Agentforce Testing Center using the testing template.
questions.answer: Create a CSV file with UC's test cases in Agentforce Testing Center using the testing template.
questions.explanation: Agentforce Testing Center supports bulk testing via CSV upload to validate agent performance against expected outcomes.

questions.question: An Agentforce configured Data Masking within the Einstein Trust Layer. How should the Agentforce Specialist begin validating that the correct fields are being masked?
options: Use a Flow-based resource in Prompt Builder to debug the fields’ merge values using Flow Debugger.
Request the Einstein Generative AI Audit Data from the Security section of the Setup menu.
Enable the collection and storage of Einstein Generative AI Audit Data on the Einstein Feedback setup page.
questions.answer: Enable the collection and storage of Einstein Generative AI Audit Data on the Einstein Feedback setup page.
questions.explanation: Enabling audit data collection allows verification of masked fields in the logs.

questions.question: Why should the marketing team use Agent to personalize emails based on customer behavior?
options: To generate relevant content when engaging with each customer
To analyze past campaign performance
To send automated emails to all customers
questions.answer: To generate relevant content when engaging with each customer
questions.explanation: Agent helps generate personalized, relevant content based on customer data.

questions.question: Universal Containers is planning a marketing email about products that most closely match a customer's expressed interests. What should An Agentforce recommend to generate this email?
options: Standard email marketing template using Apex or flows for matching interest in products
Custom sales email template which is grounded with interest and product information
Standard email draft with Einstein and choose standard email template
questions.answer: Custom sales email template which is grounded with interest and product information
questions.explanation: A custom template grounded with interest and product info ensures personalization.

questions.question: Where should the Agentforce Specialist go to access all user interactions with the Agent, including Agent errors, incorrectly triggered actions, and incomplete plans?
options: Plan Canvas
Agent Settings
Event Logs
questions.answer: Event Logs
questions.explanation: Event Logs record detailed interaction data, errors, and plan execution for troubleshooting.

questions.question: An Agentforce needs to create a Sales Email with a custom prompt template grounded on Opportunity Products, Events, and Tone. How should the Agentforce Specialist obtain related items?
options: Call prompt initiated flow to fetch and ground the required data.
Create a flex template that takes the records in question as inputs.
Utilize a standard email template and manually insert the required data fields.
questions.answer: Call prompt initiated flow to fetch and ground the required data.
questions.explanation: A prompt-initiated flow can dynamically fetch complex related data for grounding.
